Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wUVch69LuV0rkiLI7s8pOg.text: The past 36 hrs have been some of the worst of my life. My friends and I are in Vegas for a bachelorette party, having a great time until we decided to stop here.  First the hostess uses the Dim Sum (overpriced) to draw us in and then gives us menus trying to get us to pay an average of $20 for a low quality entree. We finally get the Dim Sum we requested; it tasted ok, not great. We go out for the rest of the night and by the next morning all of us are sick. Food poisoning destroyed our entire day and ruined the rest of the weekend.

XMAP-LzQoALynf-XSGmgCA.text: Leng was so nice and the manager really made sure we were taken care of. Dim sum was delish and it comes around on carts so you can see it before you buy. Will come here again! (Atmosphere is great too!)

wCilOCOt1hYy9V9m2HskDA.text: If you need a helping of dim sum, this is not a bad place to go. I came in the morning and the service was excellent. The food was decent but too expensive for the amount you recieved.   I had the short ribs, sticky shrimp balls, pot stickers, and a variety of other types of dumplings. As you can see, other than the short ribs, all I ate were different types of dumplings. Yes, they were appetizing and I recommend ordering these dishes, but I expected more options from the dim sum menu. Additionally, the limited amount in each dish can put a hole in your wallet, so hopefully, you win big at the casino to make up for your loss here.    The atmosphere is nicely decorated and full of life. With the convenience of being located in the Paris casino, I would probably return if I really wanted some dim sum in Sin City.

RUY2XIyLdQnBBcsfQo8TAw.text: A nice place inside Paris hotel&casino. Dim sum is tasty and the service is friendly. Suitable for people to eat some small things .

DwQgx2YTFbzD1lMUB_OQnw.text: Service is awesome and menu has tons of variety! Started with the pork and shrimp dumplings and moved onto the scallion pancakes and sesame noodles. All were delicious!

70PzLO86IqPl2cUUI3lP4w.text: Fun dim sum experience in the heart of Vegas! Friendly and prompt service from staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carts!

y5AB_vDKkVJNf0yZ6JEr1w.text: Great food and great service. Also the appetizer being served on table is a plus. Loved all the food we ordered. Noodles and duck was perfect with just the right spicy...

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dandan duck noodle. Simply delicious

k0h16_DMuFL5QCiNdtHY4A.text: Great food and great service, came here for my 21st bday and loved it!!! Mike is the best waitor!!!

9D5TWcGVGQsKvoML9GgvkA.text: Service not that great food extremely bland and awful water and rice was the best part of the meal which should NEVER be the case. For the price You can get a much better meal here in Las Vegas

nJ5kPmg3f0YJy-ixIVZSIQ.text: Great dim sum and dumplings. The Shanghai Lomein is more like Hong Kong style egg noodles rather than thick noodles. Overall, a solid Asian eatery with Las Vegas price tag.

ehZ0-gfjv4Gm-cqNd0bnnw.text: The food here is average ...AT BEST.  As everyone else mentioned the Taiwanese beef noodle soup is good..but for $18?! Are you kidding me? I understand vegas has high prices but this is just absurd. The juicy pork dumplings were pretty gross and the vegetables were good but then again it's hard to mess up stir fry veggies. Again though for $14?! Ridiculous ... absolutely ridiculous pricing even for Vegas for what you're getting. Make the effort to take the extra walk and go somewhere else

9qhEBu7a1-NI6bp7lmg39Q.text: This place has really good hours since it's open super late at night! I highly recommend the spicy chili wontons-- they're very tasty, with a little kick of spice! Usually dim sum is served only during lunch times, but here, it's served even at night which is a huge bonus! Mike is a very friendly server here!

DtNFpbhkK0WFRO4J3s02GQ.text: We had an amazing experience. The food was euphoric. We had the Dan Dan noodles and I Seriously am considering getting some to go to take home. But what was more impressive was watching the manager. I've worked in the food industry for years and it's been a while since I have seen someone so clearly passionate and hard working as Gustavo.  So muchso as I had to stop him and introduce myself. He really deserves kudos.  That restaurant was running like a well oiled machine and it was clear why. I'd stay at Paris again just for the food and service.

2V6mvYC67zzULyX_IQrQEA.text: This place is legit. Had the beef stew noodles and soup dumplings. Probably one of the better Chinese restaurants in a casino.

KpvzMxjB7w43LT0ZH89F1A.text: Good stuff. Had Ramin and it was delicious. Price wasn't too bad for Vegas. Ming is awesome!

PiunA9mIVLgicaQ0PuFTvg.text: Tried yong Kang street for the first time after checking in at 12;30am.   We had the steamed pork dumplings and steamed pork bun from the dim sum cart.  Both were really good.   Service was great.  Our server, Joe, was very attentive.  Kept checking in to make sure we were good with dood and drinks.  Will definitely return.

J_qaeneaJBJpZ5S4LwrNaA.text: It is very nice , there are such Chinese foods I like .  Unfortunately,  not many choices.  Hope they get better!

VnPfg8fk_rSt5IAEAEXCFQ.text: I am not sure why this restaurant has such a low rating.  This is probably one of the most authentic dim sum place in Vegas.  The flavor was great and they had two people walking around with cart.  I would say that the shrimp and pork dim sum was my absolute favorite and must try.  The flavor was on point and the dim sum was so moist.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food from the cart

D_MrBA9eqAWRGxtQNH-flg.text: The dishes and dim sum were extremely authentic and very tasty. Bland is a word they don't know here! The flavor explosion was off the charts and one of the best places we've been to in the US that actually reminds us of being in Asia. Even at 10:50pm on a Monday night the dim sum cart was still coming around with steamed items. Mike, explained to us that the day time menu has more options and the dim sum cart has fried and steamed to choose from. However we did not feel as though we lacked anything from the evening menu. Thanks Mike for your excellent service and passion for what you do! My husband and I highly recommend you eat here. Ask for Mike!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Sticky Rice Dim Sum
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Ginger over rice  (lots of flavor in this one. Don&#39;t let the photo fool you)

3sVseiXZUc0U1SvWER7Gog.text: Located in Paris Las Vegas. Serves dim sum, fried rice, noodles, and teas. Dim sum carts are available with numerous types of dumplings, fried items, and desserts. 3 different price levels for dim sum. Order shu mai which was price point B at $6.88 for 4 pieces that lack flavor and a bit tough to chew and wonton veggie soup that was $17.88 besides the atmosphere not much flavor or authenticity. The wontons were tough and just place in broth along with a few broccoli heads and green onions and slices of cabbage. The vegetables were not cook properly and basically raw. Noodles did not absorb flavor of the broth. Pot of tea is a tea bag that cost $4.88

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $17.88 wonton soup
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tea bag pot of tea $4.88

3dFLBsb3uoEpNXaIK2U-Rg.text: Surprised to find a scrumptious meal inside this hotel. I had not ventured into this part of the hotel before and was delighted to find Asian fare. My colleague and I ordered hot steamy bowls of ramen and pho which was nice on this chilly Vegas night. We also split an order of the potstickers. The dim sum cart passed by numerous times and while tempting, we decided to stick with our order. The service was attentive and our water glasses never were empty.

EQerjfu0LY0ggmUgFkgK7g.text: Mike was awesome recommending the pork and duck soup, pleasant knowledgeable about the food entertaining  The food is very good and comes out really fast

2CjS9LHxOCZfy6YfLLmlGQ.text: Wow! This place is conveniently located inside of the Paris Hotel. It's neatly decorated with lights and lamps, super Insta Perfect.   THE FOOD!! Their Japanese Miso Ramen w:Pork is soooooo tasty. The broth alone will make you want to stick a straw in your bowl. The pork is so tender and not chewy at all. Dim sum, Shrimp Sumai and Dumplings were my personal favorite. They serve an onion soy sauce for dipping. I eventually poured the sauce into my ramen and added even more spectacular flavors.   The Service: Tracy was super helpful and was very good at recommending the soup. They were accommodating and were always around to help and answer questions.   If you're looking for a place to take you away from the buffets and brunch joints, come eat here. I highly recommend it!!

dUK7ZsSJPNKz1LWsoZ7MWg.text: Yang Kang was a last minute choice for food as most restaurants had closed and the party I was with were starving. I ordered chicken with ginger sauce over rice but was dissappointed because they did not have fried rice due to it being after 10pm. I mean we are in Las Vegas!!! This dish would have been much better with fried rice. Service was ok but felt rushed because there weren't many people there and it felt like they were closing even though hours of operation say they close at 3am.

One of the dimsums we got were undercooked, but they happily replaced it for us. I bet there are better dimsum options around to try.

We had the noodle soup and some items off of the cart as well.   Everything is fantastic. It's not the cheapest, but is well worth it. Stop by, you will not be disappointed.

-qWeM46-xbVVZ8neVJgxQg.text: Great place to get some grub and cure your hangover. Their noodles and soup really help when you just need something fast and good. Food quality is good for what it is. Cant compare to the ones in LA. Service is fast and togo orders can be had in ~5 mins. Overall ill come back again for a quick fix for hangover.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fast service

Go2_5H-YXYZ_VSFXFcbYgg.text: This place is fantastic. We adored the yummy hot jasmine green tea in a cute white tea pot with tea cups. Delicious pork buns, dim sum, vegetable pot stickers, vegetable egg rolls, stir fry green beans, green onion pancakes, sesame balls, etc which come around quickly with friendly waiters pushing them on traditional style carts. We love the decors of this place and family style feel. Our intentions are to return again and again!

Vkr1jC2UCKd6b7iUPCUQUg.text: Pro's: Half decent noodles, Cool setting Con's: Horrible frozen dim sum, terrible value  Food: The noodles here are surprisingly half decent, the ramen had a rich broth and the noodles had a nice al dente texture. The Hong Kong Won Ton noodle soup was also pretty good. The dim sum is HORRIBLE, just avoid it. Its cheap frozen crap steamed in the back then thrown on carts.   If you're craving Asian this is a good quick fix in a cool faux Asian / Parisian setting. Unfortunately the convenience and setting come with a really hefty premium for what you actually get, the value proposition is terrible.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hong Hong Wonton Noodle Soup

AvhgTLaizZxRrm3Bd1V6XQ.text: If you want authentic Taiwanese food, this is where you go. Their beef noodle soup wasn't too oily or heavy. The soup was quite light! Some people might not like it like that, preferring more flavors, but if you get a beef noodle soup anywhere in Taiwan, it'll likely taste like what you get here. Same thing with the minced pork rice. If you want other Asian foods too - ramen, xiaolongbaos, you can get them here. The dim sum also looks good. Anyone complaining they don't know the prices beforehand has never been to a real Cantonese dim sum place. I checked the locations of reviewers who said that and their locations pretty much backed that up. This place is delicious for Asian food, and my parents visiting from Taiwan cast it as one of the more authentic experiences you can get on the strip

02VhKMS-94sd-hwq1mJrGQ.text: The ambiance of the pretty lanterns and people watching kept me absorbed. However I didn't try much from their menu. jLDXGS1UsxYofYNucPGuiA.text: $19.99 for beef noodle soup ? Ha ha ... It's just better go china town to eat other beef noodle soup ! After I had this beef noodle soup I felt super thirsty for whole afternoon . I was super regret why I picked this place to eat !! The service was ok !!!   My advice : 1. Save your money to go China town to eat better noodle with fair price .   2. Don't even try the Dim sum !!!

FaO4MWPao7-H7WyCg3rgJQ.text: So far the best and closest authentic place to eat ramen and noodle soup in the strip.

bSBEaBR2CldcQzsfkgcsgQ.text: I decided to try this place again...  Service is amazing and food got somewhat better but still not that great..

A8CGfns_xGEt2zymRMgnfQ.text: Well I had hoped to be one of the 5 star reviewers on this place to bring their rating up, sadly I can not. The greeters were not very friendly and were even annoyed when I asked to see the menu. Apparently it is on the wall and I just did not see it. She pointed and said it's over there as usual. Ok, excuse me for not being a usual I'm pretty sure Vegas isn't for usuals is what I should have said. I looked over the menu and wanted soup so I decided to dine.  Once at our table they asked for our drink order I mostly only drink water so I asked for that and she said you don't want anything else to drink? I said just water please. She walked away. Another lady came over asked for our order, we ordered soup with beef and rice noodles and shrimp fried rice. It took about 15 minutes to get our food.   The soup was pretty good, not the best I've had, but good. The beef they used in the soup was great with the first bite but the rest of it was all fat barely any meat. the noodles are my favorite. However, there was not enough noodles in the soup. I asked if we could have more noodles and she said sure. She brought back a totally different type of noodle and left. She never came back, I had to flag her down to let her know we needed a refill and that our shrimp fried rice was not good and we would like to send it back. She said "It's good why don't you like it?" I told her it tasted weird and we would just like to have it removed.  She rolled her eyes and walked away! A totally different lady brought our check over and it still had the rice on it. I asked her to please have it removed $14.99 for something I could not eat no way was I paying for that! She fixed it and came back, I thanked her and placed my card in the slot to pay. It took them another 10 minutes to come back with it.   Bad service and over priced so I do NOT recommend this place

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the scene here

dhn5I5CX4mOilz7m-n8BIQ.text: Have been to Bally's twice in the past few months and this is the one place we look forward to going to! Their service is amazing ((esp Mike & Joe)) and the dim sum is some of the best we have ever had! Definitely a must stop spot!

lvXJ8oqdy9X1DhEw04oYIw.text: During my stay in Vegas, I went to this restaurant 3 times, warm welcoming service, genuine food, definitely a place to go if you wanna try some southern Chinese food

vjnkIqmjVDO8AN860NSNIQ.text: This restaurant is located inside the Paris casino. We went with one of our Taiwanese friend. She told it that it was authentic Taiwanese food. OMG, she was right. u3Vg4YTAzV_pYpwbg8EswQ.text: I am obsessed with this place! I only wish they delivered. I have had the Hong Kong Noodle Soup and the Udon noodles and both were exceptionally delicious. The ramen soup was only so/so. And the dumplings were delicious.

ANwxTC5nhSGw2V6-ZSW0mw.text: This place is the perfect mix of all your favorite Asian dishes. Dim sum, ramen and stir fry! You're in Vegas so it does get pricey, but totally worth it. Definitely my new favorite place on the Strip. That spicy pork and shrimp dumpling tho.

R6H0rFXQDf05g3MvGGCf3g.text: Located straight back from valet towards self parking. Sadly I asked two people one in a suit and another in uniform had no idea where the restaurant was located much less that it even existed in the Paris Hotel.   After the sticker shock of their prices I expected INCREDIBLE food but was just ok. If I want to eat expensive dim sum and rice I'd head to Wazuzu at least the food is awesome there.  Or Ping Pang Pong at the Gold Coast just down the street. (my favorite)  The best of what we ordered ended up being their Vietnamese noodle soup (pho) at a whopping $19. At this price drive down to Pho Kim Long in China Town and you can get two yummy bowls!

gCKzWw7NmPLErFO5d1LiIg.text: First time trying this place out. Never had dimsum before. They have fried food cart and steamed food cart. Very different experience. It could of been 5 star for their good food and atmosphere but last minute impression let them loose one star.  Server was standing in front until we were tipping them for the credit card transaction. Pretty much was pressuring on tips. Server could of got 10 dollar tip on 50 check but I tipped him 8 for making me feel awkward

zu9bclsNcikVilBR-7tWMg.text: We needed a quick bite to eat before heading out to a show and Yong Kang Street was a good choice in Paris, where we were staying. Loved the dim sum cart of tasty options. We got the pot stickers and the pork & shrimp siu mai dumplings. Both tasted fresh and delicious. We shared the dan dan noodles with BBQ pork which were just ok. Sauce was very thick with a peanut butter flavor and not much spiciness. Pork on top was a bit dry and chewy.   Service was good and quick, and someone came by to top off our water during the meal which I always appreciate. I checked in to Yelp to get a complimentary Thai iced tea which was yummy. Decor is charming; if you squint you could actually kind of imagine this being a street cafe in Asia. Prices are probably pretty standard for the Strip. Overall we enjoyed our meal.

RgiGbJgV0i6L8yRSHwwFBw.text: We ate here twice over the course of three days. That should speak volumes for any who know me and my reviews, as we like to try as many new things as possible when traveling.   We were actually trying to make our way to the quick-serve crepe window down the "street", but my cousin and I both saw the sign for this restaurant at the same time, and were immediately intrigued.   Walking over to the hostess stand, we saw a couple ladies pushing dim sum carts, and made the decision to eat there. My husband had to join us, but I don't think he minded so much.   Our first time here, we were trying to snack only, as we planned on dining at the Bacchanal buffet for a late lunch. So it was with that thought in mind that we sat down to snack on a few items from the dim sum carts.   Let me just pause here to say that the dining area is kind of small, and not really conducive to having several carts pushed around, like you'd expect from a dim sum restaurant. And, though they give you a menu that lists the items you can find within the carts - from Group A on down to Group D - we only ever had carts B and C come our way. And the only reason we knew what cart letter they were is because of where the server placed the stamps.   At any rate, day one was all dim sum, shared between the three of us. We grabbed a few soup dumplings, some shrimp shumai, sticky rice, fried shrimp balls and bbq pork buns.   You know...snacking.   Everything was very good. Our favorite, though, was the soup dumplings. Especially paired with the vinegar (not the normal white vinegar, and careful on the pour, it comes out quick!)  Our second time there, the hubs decided he wanted a noodle dish, so my cousin and I shared a handful of dim sum, hubby got ramen, and I got a fried noodle dish for us all to share.   The dim sum this time around was more of the same (since soup dumplings are delicious!) My husband liked his ramen, which was good because he wasn't too thrilled with my cousin and me for suggesting this restaurant two days in a row. The fried noodles were excellent, with a great flavor to the sauce and a ton of fresh vegetables tossed in. Definitely enough to share, and to fill us up.   The servers we had on both days were friendly and efficient. The first one told us that dim sum is served starting at ten, so show up when the craving hits!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried noodles
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramen
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum round one

58Z8hVkG1xA_9hEpJdQ_-A.text: 5/5 for ambiance 5/5 for service  2/5 for food  Tl;Dr service, and ambiance is great. Food is meh, excessive herbal flavor is used to make it "authentic" tasting.   The restaurant's design is stunning. I love the design of the walls to look old school and rustic. However the booths are odd, you gotta slide in still, don't expect to just enter it like you normally would.   Service was nice, nothing to complain about. I was able to do the yell check in with no hassle, unlike other yelp reviewers. Maybe something changed? Just keep in mind you can choose from Vietnamese coffee, Thai tea, and milk tea.  Ordered dim sum and 4 different noodle soups, Hong Kong style, Taiwanese style; egg and rice noodles styles.   All the soups were very "herbal" and have a very strong taste. However, it can definitely overpower the contents of the dish and it ends up killing the flavor of the noodles and meat.  Dim sum wise, tsu Mai was fine, however everything else didn't taste authentic at all, felt like they made everything "authentic" by putting an excess amount of Chinese herbs and seasonings.   Overall, it's not bad of a place but for everything to be around $18 or so per dish is excessive and maybe exploring somewhere else isn't such bad of an idea.

3y_ukUlOgapMOWwRS9hSSg.text: Not as good of a dimsum , dumplings and noodles for the price. They do have a dimsum cart but they have three different dimsum prices which is not clearly displayed in the cart when you pick a dimsum from the cart. They just have a paper on your table that has Dimsum A, $5.88; Dimsum B $6.88 and Dimsum C $7.88 and they mark  A,B,C depending on what dimsum  you chose. We ordered Juicy  Pork dumplings $12.88 and it was dry. I think this is their  version of Xiao Long Bao. The Shanghai Lo Mein with duck which our server recommended ,$17.88, has more cabbage veggies than noodles and it was not that savory, more on the oily side. The Shrimp Tempura Udon, $17.88, came with two small tempura and maybe three spoonfull of noodles. Overall, food was okay but not something I would say "have to try in Vegas."

V0CqM_OHgKjbcjCM9dKitw.text: Food is surprisingly delicious. We're vegetarians and they accommodated our requests gladly. The taste is yummy and the service is amazing! Will make this a Vegas regular! One star taken off for price

52msDQZCWIpcswD5c7QUEA.text: We have very high expectation for this place and we could have gone to La Village next door for breakfast buffet, We were very disappointed about this place.   Ok number 1, let's be honest the food taste average, not good, not terrible but average.... 2.Service: the font desk lady Maybe she is the owner I m not sure... but her face let us feel that we owe her a lot of money, a male waiter brings me my noodle using just one hand and his thumb in the soup which made me very uncomfortable. 3. over priced, ok I understand this is Vegas but come on I can get be world's best soup in the heart of Manhattan for under $15, they charge $20 for a noodle soup. One glass of coke is 3.88.... please see the attached receipt and reconsider if you want to come.   My suggestion that is the la village buffet next to it will be better choice.

v13eNe3NI_gK-s0z_To7DA.text: Had dinner here on our last night at the Paris hotel.  We ordered some good dim sum dishes off their two rolling carts, one was for the steamed dishes and the other for the fried dishes. Also ordered some noodle dishes from their menu. Everything tasted good. My daughter had their spicy Taiwanese beef noodle soup but said it wasn't as spicy as other ones she's had previously from other places. If you like spicy food, I recommend trying their spicy shrimp dumplings. We enjoyed that dish the most. Would love to go back and try other dishes. My suggestion is if you're doing dim sum,  don't order just food from the menu. I guarentee you won't finish your food if you do. Unless you only order one or two dim sum dishes as appetizers.

JwsXK3m_r2YEH-2Bn4WwYg.text: Conveniently located in the lobby  Paris hotel, Yong Kang Street is an awesome place for some super tasty and fresh dim sum. The decor is eye catching and appealing, and the price is pretty reasonable. There is a nice array of items on the dim sum cart, much to my delight. The service was also fast and friendly. So happy to find this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delish dim sum
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qVsbZC-tcdaaTiAXRLO0dA.text: Descending down from my room, I was constantly greeted by this street market inspired venue tucked away in the Paris hotel. Sitting next to a sake bomb bar and some sushi place, Yong Kang and its giant paper lanterns stood out from the rest.  Overall the food was very typical of what you find in a Vegas restaurant - slightly overpriced food served in a area that is incredibly decorated. If i would have to guess, if feels like Vegas venues spend more time and attention to the set design of the restaurant to mask the so so quality of the food.  A few things did make this place stand out from the sea of food options. The top one being the great attitude and service of our waiter (FenFen C). She made sure to check in on our table, refill our drinks, and get out our entrees as soon as they were ready.  I would highly recommend coming here for the Dim Sum cart. yes its more expensive than your typical Dim Sum back home, but so is everything else in Vegas. They tended to have more options of Dim Sum, and the fact that there is zero wait is really great.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K2DPi3nN975Zm2Xem06Bew.text: I don't know how this place has like 3 stars.  That's definitely not fair in my book.  I've eaten dumpling from all over.  I think this place is one of the best in the country, even ahead of Din tia fung.  I always order the spicy shrimp and fresh made soup dumplings.  I come here at least once every time I'm in Vegas, as I it's one of my favorites.  Keep up the great work yong kang!

9KlD_tq3s1ToHnkxpWbP3A.text: While this was a favorite of our family from our last visit 2 years ago, tonight it just didn't cut it. We were a family divided about the rating. The dumplings were a bit tough and the chicken fried rice was rather bland. One of us had the ginger chicken. It was tender with good flavor. My husband had the shrimp noodle soup and had no troubles finishing it off.

MFzBrfh8SPxjKfOB_qULlA.text: We were here during Christmas and I really wanted some dim sum.  After reading a few reviews on Yelp, we settled with this place.  Besides ordering dim sum from the carts, we also ordered 2 fried rice dishes (lobster fried rice & roast duck fried rice).  I thought the flavors were good but not exceptional.  Also, the lobster that was part of the fried rice was overcooked and it was quite rubbery.  We didn't even order that much food but our total was $135 (before tips).  I understand that we're on the strip but I just wish they didn't screw up on the lobster since it cost so much.

zOp0QJGs8GfmQAna7Johvg.text: Late night bougie dim sum...free drinks upon check-in? Doing a review while 20% sober???  Awesome service from Mike. The man got us our food faster than I could lose my money max betting on machines while drunk.  Food is pricey, but portion and quality match. Where else am I gonna get some oriental food on the strip at 2:30am?

AATIC30XsSCbl_HCHGUt3Q.text: Good noodles very large portions. Not bad but not good either. My daughter loved her Szechuan noodles. My wife hated her dan-dan noodles. My Vietnamese noodles were fair.

HJE0XjTp9wXdrY64T3-Eag.text: *** Expensive and Tiny portions *** Food were bland and below par level to any dim sum. Ordered the following Steamed Pork Spare Ribs, Spicy Chili Shrimp Pork Wonton Dumplings, Singapore Rice Noodles and Lobster or Shrimp Fried Rice. We also ordered Thai Ice tea and received normal ice tea.  I do not even hjave one line to write about these items. Sorry to leave this review just blad like the food we had. We paid more than $200 for 5 of us for eating nothing great. Will you go there still after reading this review, only if you will die soon because of starving.

n-1T19VQF7RGH5QTrWTnqQ.text: Sat down and had an enormous amount of hot food along with beers on the table within 5 minutes. They come around with extremely addicting apprizers on this cart. We picked up the dim sum, shrimp dumplings and pork dumplings and were amazed by how good they were. They have this hot sauce/pepper mix in the table which is probably the best hot sauce I've had an Asian restaurant. Dipping the cart food in the hot sauce is probably one of the most satisfying feelings.   The entries are very large and also very good, but I'd say this place's cart food is enough to earn them a five star rating. I wouldn't recommend coming here if you're not planning on making the cart food a large portion of your meal.

_qCvvFAj-Ji2A2tGgA1s2A.text: The last visit was 5 stars because the food was great and so was service...this visit however is so not the same.  The couple in front of me left because they could get sat and I stood at the host stand for a few minutes before even being acknowledged. The guy that is probably the manager looked at me but made no attempt to say anything or seat me. The hostess finally said one minute and a couple minutes later sat me. She was friendly with Spanish speaking people behind me but not really to me.  The cart lady came by first so instead of getting the ginger chicken (which is why I came back) I got the shumai and beef something or another. And I'm glad I got something off the cart because I was halfway done with the shumai before a server even came to see what I wanted to drink.  I don't eat quickly by any means.  Food-great Service-not so great...last time was way better

HNBQMdZd09VelOQZdxbKUw.text: The best Dim Sum in Vegas! I have eaten here several times and it's always great! Tracy P is a great server, and takes the time to make sure you have a wonderful time.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best food!

MvfOM2zKdOaV09NovnNlBg.text: Great food great service excellent  Nice people very Friendly. Here is a picture of Mark eating lunch there we had such a pleasant experience visiting this restaurant for lunch wow staying at Paris hotel and casino it's near the elevators it is fantastic and the waiters are great

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good food fantastic service.

NdXkfz51qsLWcDPIVKHFyg.text: Great find - dim sum was fresh faces were so friendly and service was great thanks for an easy meal right outside my hotel room. Chicken lomein was excellent so was the udon.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ccuDqgWJPuq5yYCLwh8g2w.text: Great place for late night snack!  Pricy just like every other Asian place in Vegas but actually worth it.  It's rare to find a place with duck that is flavorful and made right !   Noodles and rice came out so quickly !! Dim sum takes a while so if you're really hungry avoid that.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D8AsSjevOwqM-foiWX7ofg.text: My go to place on the Strip. Checked in for a free drink and also received great service from Mike!

p6BEtEjtrHTp4wLPNjmBLg.text: Here on business.  Stopped by for late breakfast.  Had the Taiwan spicy beef noodles and spicy shrimp dumplings.  As a lover of spicy food, it was perfect as a savory breakfast dish.    The Taiwan spicy beef noodles is yummier than the one one in Charlottesville, Cafe 88 and Noodle Topia in Madison Heights, MI.  Was surprised because I expect Yong Kang to mass produce for the high traffic guests passing through Bally's and Paris.  Peeked at the dim sum cart, typical options and fresh looking.  Although I did have any.  Friendly staff and reasonably priced.

NGBOkeRUntQCYzYMjjFkqQ.text: Mike and manual is the best servers ever! They made the night extra special. They were very attentive and accommodating.

CawIflsZGw0LnXk9LseIGw.text: Decided to stop here for a quick late night snack because it smelled so good. Following traditional dim sum, they had someone pushing a cart of delicious dim sum delicacies for us to choose from, even at 10:30pm! Everything we got came out quick and was delicious - the noodles, dumplings, and minced meat rice. Our waiter Mike took good care of us and made us feel welcomed!  Even though the prices are a bit steep, we were happy to pay for the quality and service we received.

oq0gG34vAHwE3yNVxnQIvw.text: Great Shrimp dumplings and Taiwan beef noodle. Like the furniture and decorations here.

hTmZlwuXgiHGMpyMvdQ5OQ.text: What the hell?! I had my mom pick up a Togo order for me the Hong Kong style wonton noodle soup and they freaking gave me grilled chicken instead of wontons in the soup how does that even make sense I'm so pissed idk if they just ran out of wontons and thought hey they won't notice a bunch of fake ass Oscar Meyer deli chicken instead on top of that they are expensive as hell with small ass portions. I'm 2 months pregnant just got done throwing my guts up hungry as hell and now stuck with wonton flavored vegetable soup with noodles smh

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What it&#39;s suppose to be
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hong Kong Style Wonton Noodle Soup WITH NO WONTONSSSSSSSS

KAM1pRH7Y-0G8C4Zgf5XaQ.text: Came in late on a Friday night starving, not too  many restaurants open at Paris or Bally's. Stumbled across this place serving Dim Sum at 3am. The food, pretty good but not better than your dim sum dim sum joint but what made the meal spectacular was the attentive service of our waiter Mike.  Come in if you are in late  looking for a place to hit the spot and you'll be sure to find a quick and friendly place with great  service.

KdfTxNLj3t2SpPPmGE7mZA.text: My husband and I came here for the first time a while ago, we were drunk, & the food tasted amazing. We came here today for the second time, sober, & the foods better than the first time. The service is great. They have the nest egg rolls I've ever had my whole life. I ordered the beef soup and my husband got the beef fried rice, I definitely recommend these plates. We will be coming back on our next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MOCHI ICE CREAM

vithQOZcQS_LFsx2huXNzQ.text: The food here is just average at best and is more Americanized than authentic. Service was slow and not friendly. Don't waste your time. I think Panda Express is better.

WIxmg6p5SRRLErONsfRwKg.text: A decent choice for noodles and dim sum in Las Vegas that's located right on the strip, in the Paris hotel. I had great noodles before at the Yong Kang St in Taiwan so really wanted to try this place and see if it was authentic. We started with some pork soup dumplings that was being pushed in the cart. Bad choice. The skin was touch and it was probably sitting around for awhile. Was not hot and fresh but lukewarm with a dried up skin. BLEH. Then we ordered fried potstickers and this one came out fresh to order and it was SO GOOD. I could've eaten another plate of this. It was hot and tasty and perfect with the vinegar and soy sauce. Lastly, we got the dried minced pork noodles that was served with bean sprouts. This had a decent flavour and it was pretty good but not authentic like the ones I've had in Taiwan as I remember it. It was a good meal but not something I would go back for. Too many other foods to try in Las Vegas! The bill was pretty high for a noodle place, but then again it's inside the Paris hotel and not Chinatown so go figure.

FtwnhqnoO0U6HktcKXrg7A.text: Yummy Authentic dim sum, beef noodle and Dan Dan Noddle!!!! Will come back next time!

4YhC4kKsyPy_-4Sqrea-NA.text: Just happened to see this restaurant while going to my room  Surprised to see a Chinese/Asian that actually had decent food

sx2HZNBUBHBi1QLmt7iOdQ.text: Not a good place, the foods temperature wasn't  hot enough. The servers are rude and expect a big tips.

SR5ETku1Yg-sOyFPak1Jmw.text: This place makes me soooo sad. All I wanted was some good dim sum in Vegas but I realized it was not possible. We ordered the pork and veggie dumplings and scallion pancakes after about 20 mins of waiting in an empty restaurant. If you don't get something from the carts they walk around with, then you will have a hard time getting served. My stomach hurt for a full day after. All sad. Don't come here if you want quality.

69Me7_ba76Mkee87vEHZkw.text: Food tasted fine but nothing to rave about. Ordered something with duck and it was all bones with no meat. Everything we ordered was mostly rice and very little meat. Waste of money. Spent too much and left hungry.

nIekyyEz1oap8ITpcq3d-A.text: I ordered duck fried rice and it was lack of taste but i asked for ginger sauce on the side and that helped a lot. This place is quite expensive so might not come back. Dim sum was very expensive too. Nothing special about this place but if you crave for noodles or asian food, head to Asian Noodle at the Venetian.   Service was good tho. Water gets refilled from time to time, hence the 3 stars.

dqG65NP_5LoPv1bbGhgrDA.text: I'm Taiwanese.   This place is a no go.   Food not too fresh,   beef noodle soup noodles are horrible and chalky and chewy for $20???   Beef is tough and chewy.   Go to Ping Pong Pang. MUCH BETTER. If you want authentic real Chinese look at the people eating there.   No Asians???  No eat there.   Bad sign.   Food no good.

lh1hNepQpTCcjCPWZYKr6Q.text: Went to bacchanal but there was a 2.5hrs wait!! Decided to check this joint.out instead since we were hungry.  This place is a def of 2 stars at best.  Service was extremely.slow not because they werent trying but 2 waiters for a place of this size is crazy.  The dim sum was good but very pricey for the ave taste.  The soup dumplings had super thick skins, the chili dumplings barely had and.meat, and the pan fried.dumplings was bland.  I would not.recommend.This place, keep om.waiting for ur fav spot

rQWJot_RqHLbJcIwMgl1vQ.text: Not True Taiwanese food from Yong Kang..  but a mix between Taiwanese, Cantonese, Japanese and lots of alcohol.   It is pretty pricey, but worth it if you want authentic good  Taiwanese/Cantonese/Japanese food.     I recommend the Taiwanese beef soup noodles!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

H6szQ_DvCxEXkQNO7mfliw.text: The food is horrible, extremely salty and expensive, reason for bad rating. I arrived late from airport and were hungry and came here. 2 days later I knew there was a food court downstairs on Ballys open until 3am, where you can go straight from the Paris boulevard until the end, then use the electrical stairs down, much better option. The only good thing was the hot jasmine tea. The waiter Ivan is great and very nice.

x4GjRJasgW4NC3wijNOLhQ.text: One star for the OK-Decent dimsum. The noodles and the rice bowl, disgusting! I would be ashamed as the owner of this place serving such horrible food!!!    Do yourself a favor , there are so many other restaurants to eat at! I should of read the reviews first before coming here, cause I wouldn't have!

awnEZumr9Ga9TdbS0gx_sQ.text: I don't understand the bad reviews, the dim sum is amazing and fairly priced for Vegas. They always provide great service, very attentive. Gotta try the chicken feet! Going to make it a tradition coming here every time!

baMFQ4lldQwBrvdqOVK2lg.text: Dried up dimsum and noodle soups taste like just plain hot water. The worst, that's right, THE WORST, chinese cuisine experience I ever had. Food is very overpriced compared to quality. Food is made without any care or passion. Please save your money and eat at Panda Express! Never going back.

sQjdLpsRx6b2LItZmNY7hA.text: We came here after a long walk on the strip. We ordered the Japanese and Korean noodles. The Japanese noodles were traditional.The dumplings were by far the best I've tried. I love how they walk around with the cart of dumplings so if you want more they're easily accessible.  Also loved the decor and the attention the servers provide. Just for two people we spend 70 dollars but everything on the strip is the same price.

MIFAeE1sce5KZqWWXzt9lA.text: Casual but pretty good.  Right in the middle of the busy promenade of the Paris Hotel, so don't expect quiet and leisurely. However the food is serious.   Even at dinner time they have carts with dim sum. We had steamed pork buns, spring rolls, and pork dumplings. All hot, fresh, and tasty.   We ordered roasted pork (char shiu) which was good, not great. And dan-dan noodles which were very good.   The service was attentive and pleasant.    I would return here.

b3XNBeEvqcmlS98haOAnGg.text: I love this restaurant.  I had the egg  noodle soup with shrimp which was delicious.  My husband had dim sum and tried the shrimp dumplings and spring rolls.  Great variety and options with a reasonable price.  Our bill was around $40.

R4KKWb_W9y6--3UsXFvngA.text: Taiwanese beef noodle soup was delicious.  The waiter suggested soup at the end of the night because it has been simmering all day and makes the soup base yummy.  He was right.

yP-iNpem5akbHvo2Rr2hRA.text: found this place today after finding out dim sum at bellagio is only on the weekends but im so glad i did the prices are better the service was fast and the food was delicious

96eAjtS4i8r-NDj4-NWAhQ.text: Food and service are excellent. Everything is delicious, I recommend the lobster noodle soup and the shrimp and pork dumplings.

CechMEj5mwSUjdpGx4xy-Q.text: My husband and I are pretty picky about Asian food, but this place surprised us. We tried the lobster noodles and roasted duck fried rice which were both pretty good! Plus we liked the fact that they also had dim sum carts.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Noodles, Roasted Duck Fried Rice, with some Dim Sum. Very yummy.

rBqs89KFJgu5HsJ0ysje5g.text: This is first time for me. I'm just wanna try. Dumpling & Noodle House at The Paris Resort and Cacino. They're have so many asian noodle in menu. But the price a little bit expensive and so small portion. (Maybe Coz in Hotel but another restaurant big portion) about test is ok not bad.

t8ut0sHwK_16uQpBxpv4Gg.text: Great place and great service.... first place to eat when we landed in Vegas.... difinately coming back before we leave

EuBhnau78iwaGI3ffmJcYQ.text: When you need Dim Sum you need Dim Sum. Service ok, staff friendly... The menu states that they have over 20 varieties of Dim Sum. The carts had only a few. Like 5/6 different ones I chose twice (because I was hungry.)  My husband did ask for duck and they said they can make a "dim sum" style order special for him...and it was char su. lol  I absolutely love the decor though. Nice vibe and they did fill my water without me asking. I really like that (that is why it's 3 starts) other than that it would be a 2.

9xzQsw0STVDlk2FX0NUJgQ.text: I came here with my friends on New Year's Eve. Our server took great care of us. The sake was amazing, and the food was very great too. A hidden gem on the Las Vegas strip. Mike and Joe were great servers.

TU3kkNRr3R-lXvbnCufieA.text: Mike our server was unreal. Him and his staff were efficacy and so prompt. They make Paris an unforgettable experience.  Bone apple tea

JzbOr9mT2GLhkIr8Vh5Jqg.text: This is must to visit if you are in Vegas. I have been then for more than 5 times now. Dim-sums are really good in taste and we ordered duck noodles which were so good in taste.

lbOlc4Ao1j3M7599PrzG9w.text: We didn't feel like going far from room in Paris so gave this a try. We were very pleased. Pork dumplings were very delicious and a variety of 7 different types of dim sum. My wife had the lobster fried rice and was very pleased with it and I had the bbq pork noodle bowl. Spicy perfect!! Try it

KaeYH9YxXtaSNoP1U9nzRg.text: The food was absolutely amazing! The flavors have depth and the restaurant is quick to changeover tables. Highly recommend!

ij_69NiStgEf61XB8I9yKQ.text: With one look at this place, I was needing to try it! And I'm glad I did!! So delicious. Ordered the Taiwanese Style Beef soup and a noodle dish with bbq pork. Both very good and flavorful. I personally added more soy sauce and chili paste to the noodles and they tasted amazing.   The price was a bit high but of course, you're in Vegas. But for the portion and taste, it honestly was worth it.  The restaurant also had servers with little carts on wheels that slowly maneuvered through the small paths between tables. We grabbed some crispy, deep fried, chicken egg rolls and the sweet bright red dipping sauce. Yum. The flavor was great. They don't have much chicken inside, more of a type of clear noodle but still tasted great when dipped in the sweet sauce. I would order that again.   The staff are also very nice and was greeted, seated, and drinks ordered very quickly!

4-pC4E8aZL3jpoigw7LTkQ.text: Typical Americanized Chinese food, but not too bad.  Fried rice dishes are not recommended if you want to try some real Chinese food. The other dishes were just mediocre.

bzl2xAOP7nHS6Zo-rht5DQ.text: Great place. Every time we have a vacation in Vegas, we always have to eat here. The Dim Sum is satisfying along with their very reasonable pricing. Yong Kang Street never disappoints. Their excellent customer service pairs very well with their delicious food. For example, Lun, our waiter, was very kind, friendly, and helpful.   All in all, I definitely recommend Yong Kang Street to anyone that's on the strip.

Z1g8EIAw1YjfkumJ1HpxJw.text: This is the place for fast delicious Chinese food. Everything was good and service was fast. We had shrimp dumplings, pork buns, crab balls and chicken feet. About 5 people helped us at different times. They all work together very well. Nothing to complain about.

5KnubkrSkU6I-CxDYltiuA.text: So expensive. The taste was just fine (actually, it's below average if it was in Taiwan). I can find this in Taiwan with only 1/10 price. I know this is Las Vegas but still the food just not worth the price. I'm a Taiwanese. Very disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zbU3DwPg43dTpicgat-h7g.text: Ok so I forgot to take a photo since I was really hungry and it was really late. Landed in Vegas at 10:30 got to hotel Paris and finally got some food and brought it up to our room at midnight. I was pleasantly surprised by how good it was. We only got one dish to share, the dan dan noodles with Bbq pork. It was really good. Peanut buttery noodles with chili sauce on the side. It had bean sprouts and was very flavorful. I wasn't expecting much given the reviews but I thoroughly enjoyed it and so did my husband. We will probably get it again before we leave.

paQIuY0QMb9ZeP0OI2Mbyw.text: Began our meal with some spicy chili wontons and ha gow. Ha gow delicious enough for me to get another order, lol. Oh, and chicken feet, which were pretty good too. Wouldn't order the chili wontons again.   Went with the roasted pork noodle soup. Broth wasn't anything special and the pork was overcooked.   Only thing I'd order again is the limited dim sum they have here, meaning I prob won't be back, lol.   Waitress took a long time to finally come around to us, but once she did, she was on point with her service.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Pork Noodles
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Chili Dumplings

_a2X_YKpxcuSHUrKXtoTGA.text: Best place to go if you at the Paris hotel!!!! Great friendly staff and food awesome :)

8AmlI8Q_T-e0c2uaEI2itQ.text: Poor service. Bad attitude. Especially a young waiter, never waited for me finishing my words.   Worst Dandan noodles I've ever had.  Very expensive. Force you to pay high tips. Doesn't deserve it.

Dgsk-3b1KjAUYGYCQhXhlQ.text: First time I tried the Lobster soup and Roasted Duck fried rice and its amazing. Price is about right for the location and quality of food. The receptionist hostess were very friendly. The servers are attentive. The restaurant is clean and drives appetite when the rolling hot dumpling food comes around. Id come back for more. Yum yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazingly yummy!

wgdxZo05wJ1IBrsT0Hm3hg.text: If you like food poisoning come here! I ordered a soup to go. They didn't make it, but they had a completed different meal prepared that someone left and were so kind to give that to me. After sh*tting my brains out for a day, I came back and told one of the employees what happened. Instead of apologizing he personally attacked me and said I was full of Sh*t. I said no I'm not, I'm completely empty thanks to your restaurant. His name was MIKKY. I was not reimbursed. I should've looked at the reviews before coming here. Eat next store at the sushi restaurant. They're nice and the food is better.

7bihfnwNdmechwLDJpinIg.text: Food was good but a bit on the pricey side. Ambiance was good and not to noisy. The only thing i dont like about the place is that they let people eat in their resto even shirtless..i know its vegas but c'mon, pls ask your guest to be dress accordingly and dont let people eat shirtless!!!

wOv8jxpUkFFHnDPwekUy7w.text: Great food. Great service. Good place to go after the club. Love the lights and decor

2_-O838uue2p803q7oVMsQ.text: When you're a bit buzzed and looking for some good Asian food I would suggest Yong Kang. Just be careful of the cart of appetizers going around because that can quickly add to your bill. We had shrimp dumplings (pretty good), vegetable fried rice (very good and garlic-y), spicy pork and shrimp dumplings (bomb dot com), and chicken egg rolls (tasty). Might I suggest, if you use the scallion pancakes to make fried rice tacos, you will surely be pleased.

qkuyUuxjNBgXEi7lCdLAQQ.text: I had the bbq stir fry unon& it's good, full with flavor! It's #10 if you want it.   The service was good, food came out on time and the environment was nice and relaxing .

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrots cabbage and pork

f51QahnBpUodbPQc0mMtjA.text: Stopped by for a late night snack... amazing dumplings and ramen - highly recommend! Mike and Joe were great - very helpful and courteous!

cXx8D88pBc8mJM-KrzCn9Q.text: The items from the steam cart were hot and the shrimp rice ball wonderful. The items in the fried cart were not hot. Warm would be a generous word.  The manager took $8 off our $52 bill, which was considerate.  Would return for the shrimp ball for sure.

rjxEHW8SvpzaF0uEiWIBug.text: Our first time here at Yong kang street. Our server was Alex Y. Super nice and very helpful. We had the Hong Kong style pork and shrimp wonton noodles really good. Wasn't salty only down fall small portion for the price. We also had the spicy chili dumpling. Which was really good but towards the ending a little salty.  As for service our server Alex Y was great. He really helped us with the menu answered all of out questions and demands on some dishes. If you do go here ask for Alex, really nice guy.

LnsEIFYTuIzD1922Q6m3-g.text: Very good dim sum.  They were very good quality.  About double the cost of the ones in China town.  However,  the ambiance is much better.  Great place to people watch or have a romantic lunch.   They had some of my favorite items.   The servers were very excellent and very attentive.

2TXCmZiTySM8LoLV_wrx2g.text: Great service, the staff are very nice! Delicious dim sum :) stop in for a great lunch!

xjluG8ls_3NhFmDF9mVaKw.text: Servers are ok and they show their annoyed face when they dislike your presence.  Noodles are ok too. Wonton, duck and pork bbq (asado) has the same broth, and noodles. Their noodles are thin so u can taste the crunch every bite. Broth is rich but with the noodles it seamed bland. For the beef, their noodles are slightly thick because the broth is also slightly thick. Wonton was the least favorable.  I like how their shrimp ball is coated with rice. Thats new for me. Dimsum wasn't that hot as well as the noodles.   Note: party of 6 or more will be charged 18% more.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork barbeque noodles. Thin, crunchy noodles. Pork is very similar to pork asado. Clear soup. Lots of veggies.

lp9Lw87KVhZikFXAiHDpPQ.text: We love eating here every time we come to Vegas. Our favorite go to. Definitely recommend eating here.

G1K7Sy4mICc5KpVc1PXGjw.text: I kept walking past this restaurant all week wanting to try it, but I'm sorry that I did. I have to say, my meal was the single most disappointing meal I've ever had. A.) The menu on Paris' website has wrong pricing info. When my husband & I sat down and were handed a menu, everything was +$11 higher. B.) There were only a few pictures on the back of the menu of their dishes, so not being familiar with this style of cuisine, I picked something quickly that I thought sounded good because I was pressured to order (waiter had been over twice in a 5 minute period) C.) I asked questions about certain items, but none of the staff aside the hostess spoke good English, so I gave up understanding. D.) Fried Rice was $20 extra E.) My Sesame noodle bowl was DISGUSTING F.) My husband's BBQ duck and pork platter was dry G.)The waiter accused my husband and I of shorting the bill when it was a honest mistake, which made my husband weary and skeptical because it's not typical of him to miscount anything. .... so, basically, we paid $80 for terrible food and terrible service. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

QJp_y3EmfoPUwXxkB3qQ0Q.text: Dan dan and Shang-lo noodles were great. I always enjoy a Tsing Tao with noodles. No line, the table near us had a dog and no problem for having a pooch!

_GlcnNrKs5hMkquJegvPvA.text: Dim sum was great - though piping hot and juicy were the steam dumplings, the wrapping used was too thick - loved the taste and texture of their Dan Dan and beef noodles - the mixed veggies were crispy, but nothing special in taste - all in all, with its appealing setting - it's an ok casual spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum - dumplings - mixed veggies - Dan Dan noodles

KVJiX4VmZ_K7tyhBfjbyVA.text: Alex y is awesome. I hope he remembers me when I come back. The kid gets everything we ask for best dim sum.

zDmwuoJRsC1w4KW3oxwBIw.text: Coming from san francisco bay area where there are awesome thai and vietnamese places, we were disappointed.   Food is bland with occasional strange aftertaste.   Will not come back.

TeYms9bq-E5RayKEPj67rg.text: Food is not special but is edible. The fried rice was OK and the dim sum cart was OK as well. You could definitely do better if looking for Chinese food but you could do worse as well.

pLYbdo8SaTMIKhHWHQX6YQ.text: Opens late, super fast take out, prices are steep, char siu (bbq pork) was good over napa cabbage and rice.  If you just need your fill for chinese comfort food, def. the spot to hit up :) it was 15.88 for what I would get for 5.99 in SF but the pork was juicy and tender and wasn't cheap so I appreciated it.  Not bad and I wans't event hungry!

VRdBQCRiMzzPn8Bz9Dr0AA.text: The service was great and all the dipping sauces were delicious! The dumplings were equally as delicious!

_kBAuhO3vCop0vaDe21_5w.text: The dumplings hit the spot! Loved how the dim sum cart were pushed around! Mike is great!

WrgD_aOlNSiBczzxkMpeRg.text: Wonderful service, great food... the spicy wontons had a perfect level of spice. This is a great stop in the Paris!

1NRp_VHQRHM2EbbOoA4oqw.text: I was thrilled to find excellent dim sum right on The Strip! Yong Kang Street is on a "side street" off of the main casino area inside Paris and offers a wide array of dim sum off of carts as well as other a la carte entrees.   We came here right when they opened at 10am after arriving in Vegas on a red-eye flight. Tracey and Leng were our servers and they took excellent care of us. Leng was the main dim sum cart server. We loved her. She was hysterical and friendly and the perfect guide to all the delicious dumplings on her cart!   We enjoyed the Juicy Pork Dumplings, the Steamed Pork Buns (just like the ones I remember eating as a kid in Hong Kong), Pork & Shrimp Siu Mai, Scallion Pancakes, and the Spicy Chili Pork Wontons. Everything was incredible. I wish we only had more room to enjoy more of the menu!   Yong Kang Street was the first meal of our trip, and we told each other that this was the meal to beat!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy pork and shrimp dumplings!
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum!

kFnLFwu6RhYNwVQOdka6lg.text: I am extremely disappointed with this place. I'm not one to easily give such a bad rating, but I need to be honest.   This place is hidden inside the Paris Las Vegas Hotel and Casino. It's near a Japanese Sushi place and the JJ Boulangerie bakery/pizzeria. It's average sized compared to the other similar eateries around. The wait to be seated was decent, but the wait to order took way too long, especially considering the amount of staff they have that are standing around and some casually talking to each other.   My mom ordered the wonton noodle soup, and I had a few dishes of their Dim Sum (xiao long bao, shumai, and ha gao). We were shocked at how a place like this had such poor quality dishes at such high prices. Mine were all very dry with no flavor. And my mom's was bland with ingredients that didn't complement the dish very well. The table next to us also had issues with their dishes (meat in their soup dumplings were still very raw and there was no soup existent inside the dumpling).   The service here is also quite poor. There's so much staff but some either stand around doing nothing or just talk to each other. They're nice and didn't particularly do anything directly to make us upset. But we were pretty disappointed with their system and how they run this place.   Not only are we not coming back but we honestly wanted to respectfully explain and warn others about our negative experience before they decide to give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum - shumai, ha gao, and xiao long bao
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9TTX9C-IlPl71feocduUOQ.text: Ate the yummy Taiwanese dishes and dim sum here - duck, pork buns, dumplings, and chicken feet. The selection at Yong Kang is hot, fresh, and authentic.  This is a great place to eat with friends.   I have had two excellent meals here and will certainly return.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Har Gow (dim sum shrimp dumplings) and BBQ Pork Bun accompanied by Hot Tea!
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The excellent roast duck at Yong Kang Street. This portion will serve two easily - especially if you are adding other dim sum.

dnJIcD6Lf8ZTLUiQ-LFQoA.text: First of all, I love that there is a dim sum option on the strip!  If you are jones-ing for dimsum like I was, you might find yourself here. Yes, there is a cart that is brought around and you get the same experience as you would at a regular dim sum restaurant.  The seating is kinda on a patio like setting where you see passerbys from the casino so it is not really private.  I enjoyed most of the items until I bit into a cold piece of the chicken feet. The rest of the chicken feet was warm, but that one cold part really grossed me out. This made me realize that it was probably frozen and then thawed and heated up to be served.    Also, none of the prices were marked on the menu so we had no idea how much everything cost until we received our bill. It is double the price you will pay at a regular restaurant so keep that in mind.  Location: in Paris casino

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WiJsoJwh-hb-2eXP-ydNsA.text: Great quality food, they have such good service as well.  It's kind of pricey but it's totally worth it.  Their beef noodle soup is excellent!!!!!  The beef is so tender and the soup just so smooth!!!.  I also ate their sweet rice and it's just so yummy!!!!  Highly recommend as I am playing enough at Caesar property I got my comp.

J6fjCS76N77KVCC6BasgNQ.text: I recommend this place to get dinner here coz they have a good taste and good service some server name is mike he is very nice

OT2_C9cYzZouDet8bZdw8g.text: We enjoyed the dim sum cart on this visit.  Portions were small for the price we paid, but we expected this for Las Vegas.  Soup dumplings were small, four per serving. Staff were friendly but sort of inattentive.  We were not aware of the second cart until well into our meal.  The second car contains tempura, egg rolls, and other fried rolls.  Overall we enjoyed our meal.  Dim sum, rice, and 1 soda for four landed us at a $78 bill with tax and tip.  A five star review would have required larger portions for price and more attentive service.

ti-L0WTbllOE9teCGMUyEA.text: You have to park in the hotel for this one and pay by hour.  I really liked the ambiance setting here--the interior design was very hip and good for photos. It reminded me of a street market.   Miso Ramen was a huge letdown, especially for the price that we were paying. No one in my party liked it because it was way too salty (there were 10 of us). The toppings were bland such as the char siu.. I do not recommend this dish.   Shrimp Tempura Udon was okay. It comes with 2 tiny shrimp tempura on the side. The udon tasted as it should, you can't go wrong. We actually dipped the ramen noodles into the udon soup to mask the salty miso.   We ordered hargow, soup dumpling and shu mai! The dimsum lady was always attentive and nice.  I had to try to get the waiters attention several times and it was a small challenge but they were still accommodating when we did have their attention.  Overall and realistically, this is in a hotel so granted,  food here will be more expensive. If you're willing to splurge and pay a little extra to satisfy your asian food craving while walking around here, this is the spot to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let there be light and dim sum. Expensive but ntbd

I5KqYtHcpQQ6EnJfNrtN8g.text: 10th time here, love the food. Dim sum, noodles, noodles,  noodles! Ask for Mike!  I eat here and this is my 1st for the milk tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half duck, Taiwanese beef noodles, and HK iced milk tea

TM_q9HydFHfCYuCCPVNCIg.text: Extremely expensive food, for very low quantity. The Miso Ramen is definitely not a Miso Ramen, and the fried rice is good, but way too expensive for it's price.

6ninfQgjft_odLCrEN1M5A.text: Soooo Good! Super fast service. Love the fact that they walk around offering appetizers READY!!  I thought this was a great selling point.. they wait until you order and "drive" around with a little cart offering you appetizers... of course one is gonna get some !! Great service, great food and amazing taste! Portions are pretty big

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taiwanese Taiwanese Style Beef Noodle Soup

zPy7ZA8dqydfJ5rE0XGWwg.text: Edible, but not memorable. I ordered Dan Dan noodles with bbq pork, which came to $20. The pleasant-looking dish was a soupy peanut sauce affair, with a nice little bit of heat, cilantro and sprouts. But I don't typically get Dan Dan that comes with a spoon because there is so much sauce, and there was very little garlic. The bbq pork was dry and not particularly flavorful. They have carts that go around with dim sum. Which might be better. Service was quick. Not a destination, but ok if you don't want to walk somewhere else, get a Lyft to Shang Asian Noodle, or pay prices at Bejing Noodle No. 9 in Caesar's.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan Dan Noodles with Roast Pork

bnvhrgpeBMLz5wDaSOa6Gw.text: Services is very prompt. Food is pretty bad if you have any idea of what is consider decent dim sum. Very pricey for dim sum, but given its location and it's made for tourist. It is what it is. But back to the food... at best I'll give it 3 out of 10, most were bland or just drench in soy sauce. Highly not recommended to anyone, not even if you're hungry. Do yourself a favor and uber or taxi else where off the strip for some dynamite dim sum!  Btw his review was edit, changed from 5 stars and writing great things to this. A server said I couldn't just check in for my free milk tea, which was the deal on yelp. He needed me to 5 stars then with a picture while writing nothing by positive. I felt so fake, especially he was breathing over my shoulder until I press submit review...

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Starters

19rMNvbykH_0I8rNZFLiAg.text: My family and I are visiting from Hawaii and are staying at the Paris the past couple of days I thought this place looked good and it be nice to have some dim sum as a midnight snack. We get dim sum all the time at home so we wanted to see if it's up to par.   It wasn't. First off, wait staff was very unobservant we got our food before we our drinks. We actually had to ask for water. The dim sums were actually pretty expensive for 4 even though on the menu it shows u get 6. The shu mai was rubbery and tasteless. The "juicy" dumplings also known as soup dumplings, some were juicy and some had no soup or juice at all.   Then I tried ordering the spicy wontons. Should of avoided it. It was rubbery and had more peanut taste to it. That one had 6. Didnt finish it. Had 2 and was it. I tried so hard to want to like this place but to me it not worth it. Miss it if u can avoid the good smells that they do produce.

LfIPqHi-bE3hUTP59rMaeg.text: Everything was delicious and fast! Really loved the wonton dumplings! Just the right amount of spice and the milk tea was also a good pairing with the food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Chili Wonton Dumplings
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hong style iced milk tea

PRih7bbWcqW9Za_Pqe3z-g.text: +1 Star for free drinks upon checking in and +1 Star for okay noodles!  The decor is nice, like you're sitting in the streets of Asia. It is located right as you walk out of the hotel elevators so I think it's a pretty ideal spot. It's also open until 3am. Perfect for those late night goers and drunchies. Remember to check in to get a free drink! Choices are milk tea, Vietnamese iced coffee, or Thai tea. Milk tea tasted like water so Vietnamese coffee was the best, although we didn't try the Thai Tea.   Don't order the dim sum. Is it even considered dim sum? I know we came here once a couple years ago and it was terrible. So we didn't order any this time around.  Also the wonton noodles are not good at all. Wontons don't taste like wontons and the noodles don't taste right.   However, this time we ordered the udon, Taiwanese beef noodle, and ramen. I also like it in that order. I liked how chewy the udon was and the beef noodle was interesting. I like the chewy noodle texture and they nailed it. The ramen was okay, wouldn't order again. The lobster fried rice was just typical fried rice. The shanghai Lo mein noodles were okay as well, more meat and carrots instead of noodles.   Overall this is a good place to get something fast to eat but this wouldn't be my first choice of restaurants to eat at.

Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shanghai Noodle
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Fried Rice

W0_x53jDAm-toMtfJHJFVw.text: Very pricey average tasting dim sum but kinda expected since it's located at the Paris Casino Hotel.   There's always a lot of people waiting to eat here so decided to finally give it a try.   The dim sum carts took awhile to come out, but went ahead and ordered ramen and the pork soup dumplings.   Was disappointed to get dumplings minus the soup.  Thought it might have just been the first one but one after another they had minimum soup inside.   Ramen was tasty and portion was generous since it was pricey.    Dim sum items were good but just expensive

5B_7PdDrsjTAhswxDhEDSg.text: Come here at least once a year in January and receive great food and customer service. Brought my boyfriend while in town for Labor Day weekend since I like the place. Food was great as always but customer service was horrible. Our waiter was attentive and polite to other tables but was rude to us. Not sure if it is because we are a mixed couple or not but that was the only difference between us and everyone else. I'll think twice before coming back!!

qlxuagE5deJ_7e1dVGCAEQ.text: So I haven't Yelped in a while and thought it would be worth while to do so today. Hubby and I checked in at the Paris Hotel, Las Vegas and was greeted by the aromas of this restaurant. I am a fan of customer service (aren't we all) and also a fan of equal opportunity. So, I welcomed the opportunity to learn more about Dim Sum. Then came the rolling cart of delicacies.   There are different groupings (A-D) of which you are given the opportunity to select one or more items from the rolled cart to eat. I informed Ben (lovely person) that this was my first time and trusted him on making the choices for me. I had a duck, pork, shrimp, shrimp/pork dumpling. My apologies for not paying homage to the dish names. I am a work in progress.  I gave the restaurant only 4 stars because I have no comparisons. However, I must say that a standard has been set in my first visit/eating. Fun Fact: Ben told me that this is the first restaurant serving Dim Sum in the Vegas strip. Good job!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim Sum Juicy Pork Dumplings Steamed Pork Dumplings Thai Iced Tea

cPZpxMi461o1dOAzJsZ7bQ.text: Mike is amazing and very helpful with guiding me through the menu. The restaurant is super cute and cozy. The lighting is very romantic and would make for a wonderful date experience. The food is absolutely delicious it is very fresh and made to order.

aEbQw67PXhZyR2CHRjhcTA.text: I was hungry for a quick bite and saw the dim sum restaurant! I was quickly treated by the hostess, then seated. There was a menu to order but I opted for the quick dim sum cart. Food tasted fresh, and the dipping sauce for my dumplings was heavenly! The freshly brewed iced tea hot the spot. I tried the chicken feet, not too much meat but it was delish. I saw the complaints of the pricing by other Yelpers, but this is average price for casual dining in Las Vegas! Server Neil was attentive and professional to the table. I only have one picture attached, I was so hungry I started eating before I remembered to take a photo. I would recommend this restaurant for quick casual dining!

4lkOHZpmNYoF0L_pvO2JBg.text: I really enjoyed my visit here. Watching a woman push a cart and offer items like tempura shrimp and sesame balls brought me back to the streets of Chinatown. Here we enjoyed tasty dumplings, hot noodle soup, and tasty roast duck. Washed it all down with a ice cold tsing tao. Our server was very friendly and helpful with the menu.  I would like to give this place a another go. Maybe next time im in town.

hZOYjD8s-xK3nHuutVZc_g.text: We appreciated the manager's attempts in making our dining experience comfortable! Yelp check-in deal let us save about $10 in drinks! Dim sum was good but all items seem bit overpriced and salty hence the minus one star.

wqSbPkzVj1eR5k50719s_g.text: Great place for fresh dimsums and that is the only thing worth eating here. Tried noodles, veg stirr fry and roast duck..all pretty average.
