lybUzQ-VAH5Atay5Z67E-Q.text: Mike is the best! If u come here hope u get him. So nice and friendly. He's knowledgeable on dishes and a fun waiter! The food was great!! Def will visit again when I come to Vegas.   They have noodle soup and dim sum!! Yasss!!  P.S. Thanks for the amazing experience  while in Vegas

Hfgn_ICnwfqq1rPa6jiiwQ.text: Yong kang street is a great place for a quick fix food when in Paris hotel. Mike was very welcoming and helpful making our dining experience unforgettable.

j5P2dSjf5V1IG7iNLnbTGQ.text: Fairly expensive if you ask me. In the Bay, a bowl of DanDan noodles is at the most $12. DanDan noodles here is $18 not including tax. I think everything was overpriced but the service was really good. The food I would give it a 3/5. Check in to get a free milk tea or coffee.

WVhAUUBxdv_yVcUUG7R5Ww.text: Not the best dim sum, but you can't expect much when it's located within the Paris Casino. The staff was really attentive and friendly and the food arrived fast. I liked the decor of the restaurant that's made to mimic the streets of Taipei. SPICY CHILI SHRIMP & PORK WONTONS ($10.88 for 8pc): bit.ly/2P2ZaoE I counted only 6 wontons. - Tasty mixture of shrimp and pork was seasoned well. The spicy chili sauce was also very good. Probably the best dish we had here. SOUP DUMPLINGS ($12.88 for 6pc): bit.ly/2Q8o7vn They only gave us 4 pc. Pretty disappointing since the dumplings arrived dry, flat and void of any soup. DANDAN NOODLES W/ROAST DUCK ($17.88): bit.ly/2P4kM3R I've had my fair share of DanDan or TanTan Mian and this was not it. It's supposed to be either a ground pork in a spicy chili sauce or a light spicy sesame sauce. Our arrived with a thick peanut butter sauce that was not very appetizing. - When I asked our server about it, he said it's supposed to be like that, "it's supposed to be peanut butter sauce". Nasty. bit.ly/2JwA0Ja Over 20 varieties of dim sum cart items ranging in price from $5.88 - $9.88. There's no menu list for each item, you just have to trust that they're stamping the correct boxes on your tab. Pretty terrible system on top of the already inflated prices for dim sum that normally than $3-4 bucks at better dim sum joints. BLACK BEAN SPARE RIBS: bit.ly/2ESJIXn As you can tell from the pic, it's missing the familiar black bean gravy. Bland to say the least. FRIED SHRIMP WON TONS: bit.ly/2qkR7Vx Two huge wontons filled with a lot of whole shrimp. A bit greasy but tasty. Can't go wrong with fried food. SHRIMP&PORK SIU MAI: bit.ly/2Q8nyBL It tasted just like the spicy shrimp&pork won tons without the sauce. Good, but I've had better. LO MAI GAI/STEAMED MOCHI RICE WRAPPED IN LOTUS LEAVES: bit.ly/2Pv79dC This was one of my favorites because the mochi rice had the right consistency of what I'd expect for Lo Mai Gai. I also loved that it had a generous portion of ground seasoned pork and chunks of lup cheong mixed in with a tasty gravy. Probably one of the best Lo Mai Gai I've come across yet. BLACK PEPPER SHORT RIBS: bit.ly/2Ss0bER Bland and hard to chew. I looked like a starving rabid dog trying to bite into this. But since it was overpriced, the Chinese part of me was telling me to not waste. Let go, Let God. Hours: Daily from 10am-3pm Located within the Paris hotel & Casino, parking is $13 for 4 hours, $18 for 24 hrs.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large Fried Shrimp Won Tons full of tons of whole shrimp.
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lo Mai Gai: Steamed mochi rice, ground pork and lup cheong, wrapped in lotus leaves
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DanDan Noodles w/Roast Duck ($17.88): It was basically peanut butter noodles. Pass.

3mxKkJX_Uw-a0dJYw3QaCQ.text: Yong Kant Street is a dim sum restaurant in the Paris Hotel.  Last Friday, my husband and I had tickets to see a show at the hotel. We knew we couldn't miss picking up our tickets at will call so we made a decision to have dinner at the hotel.  We were very hungry when we got there, but as none of the many restaurants and delis we walked past interest my husband until we saw the dim sum cart at YK Street. So we pulled in, was quickly seated.  In no time was the cart there and we picked out our favorites, har gow, baked pork bao, custard mini pies, DUCK, pork shumai, and some other fried shirmp and vegetable won ton. Oops, and I can't forget the house fried rice with beef, chicken and shrimp.  The service was great.  Great atmosphere. Food was great. Then my husband looked down at the stamp card and realized, it's expensive, like twice the cost compared to the other dim sum restaurants off strip. Well, it is the strip, it is a popular hotel and we're hungry, plus we got free show tickets, so this one time is okay. But that is the only reason why this gets a 4-star instead of 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All time favorite, baked pork bao (mnapua)
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not sure what it&#39;s called but it is filled with shrimp and veggies.
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Husband loves these custard mini pies

_lJJRAcVgOcHsBsVnTPG7w.text: This place is my favorite restaurant at the Paris hotel in Las Vegas. They have the most delicious dim sum. My boyfriend and I came to have late dinner and they have dim sum carts coming around.   The lady serving the dim sum gave an explanation of each item in the cart which was very useful. We had ordered: 4 juicy pork dumplings, and 1 bbq pork buns! We did add some Chile paste that is on top of the table to our dishes and it was very yummy if you enjoy spices.   Everything was hot and service was great! I highly recommend this restaurant, they close at 3 am.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juicy pork dumplings

9MCs4zT8UZua5snfsswlgQ.text: DIM SUM PARIS HOTEL  Surprisingly the dim sum and noodles here are authentic. Quick service and friendly staff!

zb9MKNYn_a826CGdKiih4w.text: If you haven't tried spicy Sichuan wontons, I guarantee you that you will be enjoy them. Once you try them, you will want more. Them little dumplings are utterly addictive, one bite of the incendiary chili oil and the explosive flavors, there is no turning back.  In a place called Paris, deep in the heart of The Strip, you will find them. Shrimp and pork hand wrapped are floating in cilantro, green onions, and a special chili oil mix. Just the right amount of heat and savory flavors makes for a delicious snack.   I can't walk past Yong Kang Street without stopping in. My 48 hours in Las Vegas, I must visit at least three times!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Pork. 1/2 fat-1/2 lean!
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Five decent dumplings.
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice Shrimp and Pork Wontons. Cabbage and green onions in a savory broth.

WcmQoCSACLtOCrNZ2Z3SHA.text: Who serves rice-based Taiwanese dishes in plates? Lettuce with rice? LOL K. Go with the noodles, they're much better.

EiBFWarQEFi6hquK6WQ8xw.text: Yummmmy dim sum to start the day in Paris  Staff friendly and courteous.  Good tasty, loved to juicy dumpling

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum love choosing from the carts!
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In Paris

ayZvJ422shSpvcscuQRBDQ.text: Mike and joe with the good late night food service. Soup and noodles after alcohol always a

kslsV74aqqktVhw2vVCgTg.text: This was a pretty fun way to try a lot of different food. The lady pushing the cart was super nice. All the dim sum was pretty good. The skin on the duck could have been crisper, but the flavor was good.  The thai iced tea was great. We did end up spending a lot of money, but we got a ton of food.  Definitely go with a few people so everyone gets to try some and share.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai iced tea.
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck, shrimp wonton, and gluttonous rice ball.
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Har gow and shrimp pearl balls.

wzJhVXXRpBFv2VU2Yblxtw.text: This was the perfect place to satisfy my hungover food cravings. Noodle soup is honestly my favorite and only thing I'll eat when I'm trying to recover from drinking.   Yong Kang Street answered my prayers by not only having pho, but also every other kind of noodle soup you could think of. My friends and I got a bunch of different ones including pho, Taiwanese beef noodle soup, wonton noodle soup, and bbq duck noodle soup. We agreed that the Taiwanese beef noodle soup was BOMB.   Shoutout to Lun for checking up on us and making sure we had everything we needed. If you want hoisin sauce, just ask! There's also a check in offer for a free drink. The Vietnamese iced coffee was strong and tasty, and had a hint of chocolate.   We left Yong Kang Street feeling more alive and ready to take on the rest of our night. We even tried to come back the next day, but there was a bit of a wait :P

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho &amp; Vietnamese Coffee
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mochi ice cream- I believe it&#39;s green tea, red bean, and mango

CFN1XrsnrDnpapBpbRe5jg.text: The food was amazing here. I had the udon noodles with pork. So tasty! Mike , the manager this evening was very professional and attentive. Panida was so kind:) she didn't let my water glass go empty. I would totally recommend this restaurant. Thank you to the staff of Yong Kang Street!!

NEztgfvXUtha4CvwLSL4Yw.text: Wife and I love dim sum and she hadn't been feeling well on this trip, sadly it wasn't due to drinking more just general nausea.  Thought I would get her some comfort food while we strolled through Paris.    This place is tucked away but a really cute oasis.  They had dim sum carts, noodles and regular dishes to order.  We giggled as some people had never had dim sum before and would ask what the cart was suppose to be addressing.  Wait staff would yell "they're appetizers", unique spin and makes sense. They had a diverse amount and 2 carts passed by, fried cart and a steamed cart.  Really like the separation between the 2.  Would love for them to add some sobe/udon noodles.   It wasn't like our fav dim sum places but it hit the spot.  Only recommendation, don't get the juicy/soup dumplings.  No soup to be found and the dumpling just wasn't good.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of Yong Kang Street within Paris

njp6oAMVTnig7b0H2nrqVQ.text: Wow this place was better than I expected! The veggie noodle soup was amazing. Perfectly tasty and then I drowned it in Sriracha!! Ugh sooo good and they walk around often offering all kinds of dim sum options. I was led over from my room at Bally's they have a walk through that's attached to each other. You won't miss this place it also has a sushi place right next to it that's also really good. The soup wasn't oily at all or overly salty it was perfect. I haven't tried anything else but I'm sure it's all good. The service is good they are pretty on point. If you have ceasars reward and want points for this meAl get a copy of your receipt then take it to the rewards desk

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum card
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Area
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie noodle soup

wG45XMzKB4tWchV5CFTYqw.text: I would give lower stars just for the service of the receptionist. Food wise and the actual server/waiter were good. We just walked in, and we were the only ones waiting in line and the lady mentioned 30 min wait and she said to write our name down. Then we thought about it and we're like ok we can write down the name, then she is like you just have to be here we don't take names. I asked her how many people in front of us, and she said it's just us. Then finally she said we are next so it should just be 5 minutes. We got the table in less than 5 minutes........  But just the way she was talking was like she doesn't want business and she could have mentioned we're next anyways instead of all the discussion above.  3/4 of us are vegetarian, but 4th person who ordered dim sums really liked them. I ordered fried rice and it's like any other fried rice so I can't complain. Other vegetarian food were average so it's probably more for dim sums.

HR6s36qjmn5K3iQpsa8ovw.text: This is a great place for late night, after a concert. The food is fresh and fast.  I was skeptical about Asian food at the Paris hotel but it works!

_lbSln8K6x2uC8H9sT6Nrg.text: Awesome service and great food! Definitely come here and see Bonita! Fantastic experience!

w9rZ4CKELvqLNryGiGvu4w.text: Delicious food and stellar service. I had the sesame noodles with peanut sauce, full of shredded veggies. Husband had udon chicken noodles. He was thrilled. Getting used to the dim sum lady took a little getting used to, we likened it to a mobile sushi track...moving the dim sum around the dining room! We thoroughly enjoyed and will be back.

7-t5O45I3lvlDH1qd1JBrw.text: Just down by the elevator so wanted to try despite not so stellar reviews. However the for was good . Highly recommended dry noodles. Dim sum esp shu mai was yummy ( make sure you get those steaming hot ones) . First round they served the old cold one and was Ok.

izcEq4xcypmnVP83-hmbaA.text: Darn. I thought I left a review. Any hoo. Not recommending this place. Should have read reviews first. I had the Vietnamese Chicken Pho.......the chicken was definitely frozen first. Lol. Maybe from Tysons frozen chicken bag. My husband's chicken fried chicken....tasted burnt.  Again from frozen chicken. All restaurants from Paris so far gave been great. Not so mych this place. Better places to spend your hard earned vacation money for sure!!!!

FdFVvzs544XiOkmT94R4Ig.text: Great service and location. Thai tea is delicious. Located in the Paris across from the elevators and open until 3 am.

DB2NA8vm69KnCjAZhnnTqw.text: We all had noodle soups...Vietnamese, Hong Kong, and Taiwanese soups.  The Taiwanese soup has a slight slickness to it...just right if you usually like a little spice...some of the other people in our group still added some chili.  These soups hit the spot after a great nite out.

XsDBxj9aYlK6jODWj1Uvqw.text: $18 bowl of chicken Pho. Was mediocre in flavor. Even after I doctored it like usual. Service was good, friendly staff, pricey for ramen and other noodle in my opinion but hey it's Vegas. Dim sum looked good but I wasn't in the mood this time. I'd probably pass in the future.

mP20T9ZyUKscMftO4zLhdA.text: Great food. i love the a la carte food. Chicken feet, pork and siomai tasted so good. Must try their noodles too

HLdpaXIpVYZrmyCfEIPDCw.text: A restaurant that when busy you are not looked after by any server! Would of ordered way more..but just a sigh..... Mind you when we arrived the girl that welcomed us at the door was the best, polite, nice and smiled... which is more than what we got the rest of the night.  Food was average, the duck did have a good quantity of meat on it which was a nice surprise. The trolleys of food was not exactly hot, and when we asked waiter what the difference in ordering off the menu.. which works out cheaper..  He said nothing different.. all comes from same stack from kitchen.. Oh dear.

Q8U9Gla9ROU6wgATPTey_w.text: Starting a new tradition to come here every year. Great dim sum and love the beef noodle soup!

U5lC4zYJ8X3IExZs2qBzqQ.text: Mike and Alex best server great service. And the food came out fast and hot!!! Impressed for Taiwanese food!!

igUtAy335FzB-STE6RMt4Q.text: Mike was a great server The food was fantastic I recommend stopping in I liked the way they came to the table and presented the food Dim sum was delicious.

aCVt9wxNZyjirQBJkstk1w.text: Great ambience, really great selection of Taiwanese food and dim sum. The beef noodle soup and lobster fried rice were fantastic. Came and ate here two days in a row because it was so good.

bLRwseJkP-ojZJ09sZLIjg.text: Great food great service and quick! Mike is one of the best servers I met, make sure to ask for him!

ub2pyqIe9ue_UuGgVmIV4g.text: A nice treat in Paris hotel & casino. Good dim sum, and a wonderful variety of noodle dishes to choose from.

kdLPpv2xaKzTV34qgeLGzw.text: My reliable go-to Asian food joint on the Strip. Prices are a bit expensive for Chinese food but very reasonable for Strip food pricing.  Staff has been consistently friendly--most speak Mandarin. Dim sum at all hours.  There isn't a gigantic dim sum menu but all the classics are there:  shumai, shrimp dumplings, egg rolls, fried dumplings, etc.  My favorite dish is the Hong Kong won ton noodle soup. Very tasty, classic Chinese food--fresh bok choy & generous tasty won tons. Their Taiwan beef noodle soup is also a classic and delicious--savory generous portions.

bUKLNQ6VbeY-4ASgF1AHbg.text: The ad is deceptive. Yong Kang Street should not be located inside Paris hotel in Vegas. Food truck would serve them best. Food is ok. Dim sum is just one cart with same "potstickers", etc. Disappointed. Not a cozy environment.

noyco2hpti9EUmEpYUyuIw.text: Tonight was ended perfectly, Mike hit the ball out of the park with the Sesame Noodles recommendation. Went to bed with a happy stomach. BOMB

JieKd4mmV27tRCLper8Cdg.text: Very good Beef noodle service and great service. Definitely will come back here next time when I visit Vegas!

A5pESfvxjj9uBN2e0s6PvA.text: I spent a year in Taiwan so when my wife saw this restaurant during a recent visit she had to take me there. This a close to what i ate in Taiwan. If you are looking for the sweet American style Chinese probably not your choice at least the food we chose. Dim sum carts had some nice chooses. I has roast duck. I got hooked to it while over seas. Duck was very good with great crispy skin. We also had Taiwanese beef noodle soup. Broth could have had a little more flavor but it was very good. Prices are high

f1vQbElOnzFonLdL1hT4AA.text: Just had some great ramen at the MSP airport on my way to Vegas, but what the heck, I can't turn down good noodles...the dim sum cart is top notch and the ramen was damn tasty.

UtE9jMTaBDHI37kSLqAAjw.text: They absolutely refuse to answer any of their telephones, so good luck getting a hold of them if for example like me you'd like an itemized receipt. Their inbox is full so you can;t leave a message. And you can't get an itemized receipt from them through  Paris Las Vegas accounting.  Stay away if you value normal Western standards of service.  The food? Hohum.

Grt3AqKp9uLhb4XAtztTkQ.text: This restaurant is an embarrassment to the Paris Hotel. In the middle of Chef Ramsey's and Martorano's, really??? How did they even get in? The food was horrible, I wouldn't even feed it to my dogs. I was served beef tongue in my beef soup. Why was it not on the menu description? The taste and smell alone was anything but pleasant. The service was good, but seriously, the food, how can anyone on this forum say anything good about it? Relatives, friends? Surely they have to be. I have been to several Asian places, and this is by far the worst I have ever been to, in fact, the worst food I have ever eaten in any restaurant all over the world. I hope Paris gets word of this and others that have left similar reviews. It has no business there, at all.

-xFvJQ4zeIm-3IStJYCZUA.text: Had a few random dim sum dishes as well as the beef noodle soup. Service was fast and though not perfect, pretty good for a "Chinese" restaurant (as others mentioned, they serve a mix of Cantonese, Taiwanese, and even Japanese inspired dishes).  Dishes are all probably about 2X as expensive as they would be outside of the Vegas strip, but that just comes with the location.  Would add that the server did hover over us while we were trying to write in the tip on the receipts instead of waiting till we were gone to pick it up.

T2vQmaIo1w4Ni804705UeQ.text: Avoid this place not only is its expensive the food is God awful. We order two orders of spring rolls that looked and tasted like they came from the frozen food section of Walmart. Not only were they awful they were still cold on the inside  Order bowl of Won Ton soup that the broth was boiling hot and tasteless. The Won Ton were over cooked and soggy  Only saving face is fresh set of customers daily. If this place was off strip it would be closed with food like this  The hostess also had an attitude, seems not only she not care she was rude. The other customers sitting around us also were not happy with the food nor service

TA9R2qu1d8DT-upI0CezWw.text: One of the few places that are not filled during holiday. You can find a table here almost any time - that is a huge plus. Other than that the food are really not great.

HRUA7lkZTpmYwjRzVRlzaQ.text: Sounds like most of the negative reviews are from stuck up rude people that have never eaten fresh food. I've heard one person complaining it was tasteless while the next person said it was too salty. In case you have never eaten Chinese food or noodles, umm, it's salty., but In a good way. The next beef seems to be that it's expensive. Yeah it's expensive. No doubt you can find the same meal somewhere for at least half the price, not sure where but I'm sure they are out there some where in the slums of vegas. You won't find it in the strip in the middle of a huge casino hotel. They have to pay rent to be in such a prime location. So you get to pay for the convenience. As for the food. Absolutely amazing. Super fresh and off the charts. We didn't mind one bit paying the bill. It was one of two restaurants that we ate at that made our entire trip to Vegas worth It.

DJ179TPrsnfJx7JK-Oeu_A.text: I really do hate to write negative reviews.  I rather not say anything at all than write a bad review especially for a restaurant in Paris where overall all the restaurants are top notch, including the buffet.  With that being said though I'm hoping that they take this to heart and improve.  My husband wanted to order white rice to go and maybe a few other things but the hostesses were simply unhelpful.  First, they said that they don't do to-go orders after 10 p.m. but it was 9:45 p.m.  So they let him order.  Then we asked what do you get for the different prices of dim sum- crickets...they had no idea.  We asked if they had siu mai- no idea.  Asked how much har gau was...not a clue.  And best yet they didn't even want to go to the dim sum cart to find out.  So, we got our $3.88 order of white rice; our $8.88 har gau (which is a RIP OFF); and, some pork dumpling thing that she insisted was siu mai (IT WAS NOT).  Educated your staff as to the food you serve.  Sad...

Zi5PCrGUY0pogLHcdrly9w.text: Long lines, food is just okay.  The list of menu offerings is reasonably authentic but the quality of the individual items is only just okay.

4hDs3Wf1AP90-hiqt8H8Mg.text: Young Kang Street is a great place to stop in late night for a quick bite if you're in the Paris hotel. The BBQ pork over rice and the won ton soup are excellent choices. Service is also excellent. They are open till 3 am.

1Ygr3wTwZuEqnm0lMifFzg.text: This is not how dimsum is supposed to taste like! They pride themselves as the first dimsum cart restaurant in Las Vegas strip but they are doing it all wrong. This is messed up because they are giving dimsum cart a bad reputation. No justice! People, pork siumai does not cost $7. For 4 tiny pieces! Do not come here. You will regret it.

AgqI0QlrkuKCBgRMITfBTQ.text: We were staying at Bally's and were looking for a place to eat a light lunch nearby. 1 adult, 2 seniors and 3 children including added gratuity came to $157. No senior discounts. The decor  resembles a street scene in a Hong Kong action movie in the 80's. The long tables by the wall had bench seating on both side which was hard for my mother to get in and out of. The Vietnamese noodles were tasteless and did not come with hoisin, basil or bean sprouts. The Taiwanese beef noodle was good, not spicy as advertised, the meat was soft and tasted like oxtail. The summer special stir fried udon with bbq pork was heavy on the sesame oil and just ok. The shu mai and har gow were forgettable. The egg tarts were good but overpriced for two (better in San Francisco). Best thing- they had baked char siu bao which my husband and the kids enjoyed as snacks. Ok if you are desperate for dim sum and have a lot of money to spend.

83d_6Pswij8cj9ZheKmBzA.text: Good value quick service duck and pork bowl very good. Dim sum limited hut decent priced for las vegas very good.

9KJRRwJn-sno7t0UAnV0gg.text: I wish I could give them "0".dan Dan noodle is presented with weird spicy sesame source and some overcooked bean sprout.it looked gray color and look like a shit. Doesn't look tasty at all. I tasted a little bit. It's strange flavor. It's complete wrong dishes. I asked a waiter. He said that is Dan Dan noodle. Don't expect you will get authentic , good quality Chinese food here. The price is high too. Their menu price is different from the price online! , so I checked out with tips. That's it. Don't go to this place even for try!

aeBEhlWJJwHWFd3oQpdRaw.text: #7 Dandan noodles were ok. Little flour taste to then. Over all ok. The manager shoved me and called me am asshole after waiter spilled and broke glasses on the person I was dinning with!  He could use some anger management courses.

ek4Y2m8lwf08zL0_pIfCUA.text: Service was bad & slow but food came fast. I loved the dumpling lady! She was great & recommend good choices! I'd would have preferred to just eat dumplings the whole time. Lol. But for reals this review is mixed. My husband liked the food but I didn't, I guess I prefer more sweet food. Also I didn't like how our server recommend the noodles with chicken but we ordered the noodles with BBQ pork & when the food arrived it was with chicken.

K5z1XhicQ-hdrmDHJGJEzQ.text: I have been to a lot of asian restaurant and the food here tasteless for the price at least the dim sum is ok but still over priced.  Service charge is immediately added for group of 5 at 18 percent when service is awful.   I think Paris Hotel should evaluate this restaurant.

69tRX16nrH3Rl_MhKIQ2pw.text: Just what we needed!  Tonkatsu pork ramen, udon noodles and dim sum.  Like alfresco dinning.   Perfect.  Nice service and tasty tea

iitU83uNpWBiKu5tbPTDXQ.text: Tracey and the service are amazing. We ordered the Japanese Ramen noodles and the chicken Hong Kong bowls. Delicious! The dumplings (veggie) and sticky rice are 2nd to none! I can now wait to come back.

BqdE7ZwZ9T7TbZjpkUCXrA.text: Our server Mike was amazing! Suggested the spicy chili wontons.... and it tipped off our meal. Everything was delicious for a good price... late at night in vegas...  and Mike was still so friendly and upbeat. Most late night places.. you usually get those tired, irritated servers. But not him! Definitely recommend this place!!!

pnq4L5VY08V3PTkcFpgbSQ.text: Food is good.  Dan Dan noodles was tasty peanutty with some spice.  Mike the waiter was on point and handled our every need.

e5C5qDFAzTCkgPF58EZE2w.text: Mike was super fun and made the experience great!! Food was delicious ! Super quick service.

6gh2FJtmFg1ybgxuyWnKEQ.text: Surprisingly decent. Scallion pancakes were tasty and the service was nice. I would not recommend getting the juicy dumplings though

piFFyNy22Fgh26oV2hNPNg.text: My family ate at Yong Kang Street on New Year's eve.   What I like about Yong Kang Street was that they were very accommodating. My sister and I are vegetarians (going vegan). The waitress told us that we could change the broth from beef broth to vegetable broth! Yay! This won a few extra points in my book. There weren't that many restaurants that offer this. The vegetable noodles were absolutely scrumptious. It's a good portion of food. It isn't as flavorful as other noodles that I have had, but if you add some sauce its pretty delicious.   I also ordered the spring rolls. This were perfectly crisped. For two egg rolls, the cost was $5. What knocked one star off this restaurant was that the prices were steep. I believe for my vegetable noodles were $18.   The waitress was very nice and the service was speedy. When we first arrived at the restaurant there was a line of about ten people. We were seated in 10 minutes or less. If you consider that it was New Years Eve, this wait time was excellent.   This restaurant does have a Yelp offer. I wrote this review after my experience at Yong Kang Street. The waitress didn't ask me to write a review before in order to receive the free tea. The free tea did not sway me in writing a more positive review.

C6lZ-sYxaUCvqbo6L_7THw.text: Enjoyed our dim sum cravings while in Vegas. Great service. Friendly staff. Another go to when in Vegas

jRZTNM8KY4HlRhyJfF0-4A.text: Great location among the hustle and bustle inside Paris hotel and casino.  Very kind staff seated me in a great "people watching" section.  We worked with many people for ordering Dim Sum.  The gentleman pushing the cart was very nice.  Same goes for the guy who took my drink order.  A big bonus was a free Thai Ice Tea from checking into Yelp.  The big reason they are getting only 3 stars is because of the quality of the Dim Sum.  It definitely tasted like it had been reheated and was not fresh at all.  For both the Shrimp Dumpings and the Shumai.  We are probably spoiled from the fresh Dim Sum we get at our favorite restaurants in Seattle, but we expected more from Paris.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9H6b4_hgLfkAGjkUXjXCHw.text: Solid 4-star Chinese eats here!  We ordered a couple items off the dim sum cart and a noodle dish with duck.  Everything was tasty!  Service was excellent, our server always checked on us.  It's a bit pricy for dim sum, but given it's located inside the Paris hotel, it's not too bad.    I only wish they made egg tarts as part of their dim sum menu.

2KjJX33Ft2tZD-GlVRoLCg.text: Yummm!!!!! This restaurant is delish! Joe and Mike are the best servers! I'm here for my best friends bachelorette and they made this event so special. They had amazing recommendations and the food is amazing!!!! Will definitely come back every time I'm in Vegas!

w1Es4OK0xHFDNVTX1Fp92w.text: First time Trying Dumplings and I am Hooked! This place has a cool atmosphere and the food is delicious! Will be coming back! The staff is amazing and very polite!

qOQQxyU-FXI83KKOP7rBjA.text: This restaurant is located inside the Paris hotel. My husband and I were looking for a place to have dinner and I was originally set on a Parisian style restaurant, but I couldn't pass up this cute restaurant. I'm a sucker for atmosphere. We were quickly seated and greeted by our waiter. I noticed that our table was quite wobbly so I folded up a napkin and placed it under a leg of the table. A worker saw me do this and alerted other workers to come fix our table. About 3 people rushed over to help out. We weren't very bothered by the wobbly table but they insisted on fixing it and even told us we could move. We greatly appreciated the help.  If you check in on Yelp, you get a free beverage. Normally it's one offer per table but our waiter said because it was New Years, we could each have a free drink. We choose the Vietnamese coffee. It was sooo good. I love strong coffee. We also ordered some juicy pork dumplings as an appetizer. These dumplings are filled with a broth. These are a must! We were sitting next to a worker on break. She saw me looking perplexed about the condiments on our table. She kindly informed me what each one was.   For our entrees, my husband ordered the a Japanese ramen and I ordered the Vietnamese beef noodles. It was so much food. We were so stuffed by the end. Menu items were reasonably priced for Vegas. Also, it's nice that they have a variety of Asian food on their menu. Our waiter and all the workers were so friendly and attentive. We were very impressed by the great service, food and atmosphere!

lbCUbIhPb_1vWRu_Ls9yRA.text: Stopped by around 10:45pm and our waiter was Joe! Let me say that the food was freaking AMAZING! Very delicious specially the Dim Sum! And the service was great. He was quick with our drinks, recommended good plates and was very nice and caring! I'll definitely be coming back! Thank you Joe!

HHDTmpjCvSt6y4PXlTxMKQ.text: I was a little skeptical of this place as I was really hungry and have never had much of an appetite for soup-type meals, but I was pleasantly surprised.  First and foremost, incredibly friendly and attentive staff. We were seated immediately and were helped with the menu since we are not too familiar with Vietnamese cuisine. I ended up ordering the Vietnamese Iced Coffee and the Pork Ramen and Pork Dumplings. All items were prepared to perfection and I was completely satisfied. I left full, caffeinated, and content with my experience.  A unique restaurant experience if you are tired of buffets and burgers in Vegas!

KJk_YoP3qhr1-wOSaf0JpA.text: In town for a women's convention. Some of us came across this spot on the way to the room. Definitely glad we ended up stopping here. Mike had awesome service and great energy! He's the main reason I'm giving his place 5 stars.   The food was good and the music was at the perfect level!  I don't usually write reviews , but Thank you Mike !!

jt8gFsGfQ-6iZ6mbzWEFkA.text: Delicious beef noodle soup and Thai iced tea. Little pricey but great atmosphere and location. The beef noodle soup isn't quite like what I remember in Taiwan (a bit spicier) but still worth it.

_DXTcw7VYGw9PLccnc9RFQ.text: Overall Amazing experience. Good food, spectacular customer service and authentic ambiance. I feel like I'm in China. Mike was accommodating,friendly and attentive. Would recommend anyone to come here.

hx9RzwbjUIRJmAZwlqJhLA.text: After reading several reviews we decided to give this place a shot. There was no wait and the vibe is as if you were eating in the streets of Taiwan. First thing that greets you is a cart with several appetizers, you can select what ever you want on the spot and it gets added to your bill. Prices seemed reasonable for Vegas, for it being a quicker bite, and for it not having a wait. We shared several appetizers such as pork dumplings (highly recommend), chicken egg rolls (highly recommend) and shrimp friend wontons (save your money). Our main entree was the chicken lo mein, which was not greasy and very tasty! The bill does add up with the $4 iced tea and the $7 appetizers. Don't get too carried away with the appetizers! Total was $55ish with tip, could have eaten at a nicer place for that, but it was a nice experience.

oMd0ZOkIudtMXie9aUnDow.text: I love the restaurants inside the Paris hotel. You get to feel like you are dining al fresco with their faux cloud ceilings and winding paved walkways, without having to actually sit outside in the desert heat (yes, please!).   My friend and I had just finished our massage appointments and were starved, so we suggested meeting back up with my husband here since it was a halfway point between the Bellagio (where we were) and our hotel (the Mirage).   They weren't busy when we arrived, so we snagged a table next to the main walkway for optimal people watching views. We ordered two beers and their steamed pork and vegetable gyoza to snack on while we waited for my husband to arrive. They were delicious and disappeared from our table quickly.   They also rolled over a dim sum cart filled with piping hot treats and gave us their group menus to help determine what everything was. Group A is $5.88 an item, B is $6.88, C is $7.88, and D is the most expensive at $9.88 a piece. We were more in the mood for noodles though so we decided to pass on the cart offerings.   Once my husband got there we ordered another appetizer for the table, this time being the spicy chili shrimp and pork wonton dumplings. Those are addictive! I could have easily put away 4 more plates of those by myself. Don't say I didn't warn you.   For our mains we got hot sesame noodles with BBQ pork, and hot Dandan noodles with chicken (you can get their noodle dishes either hot or cold). The peanut sauce on the Dandan noodles was perfectly balanced with notes of sweet and heat, but the sesame noodles were probably my favorite because of that yummy pork. It was smokey and fall apart tender.    This meal really hit the spot and was perfect for sharing. It's a little on the pricey side, but that's to be expected of most places on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dandan noodles with chicken
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy chili wonton dumplings

JorOym_cSs4k4eMgryeZzQ.text: Attentive and fast service compared to surrounding restaurants. As soon as we sat down, we were approached by the wait staff for drinks and dim sum. Entrees are also turned around quickly. Also, we got the Thai Tea and Vietnamese Coffee, which quenched our thirst from the hot 100 degree weather.  Overall, the food is on par with any dim sum/Chinese bbq restaurant in the San Francisco Bay Area.

eyKHOBY9CAxdsSkDKxwBWg.text: Dim sum on the strip!   The prices here are a bit high for dim sum but it's the strip so I don't expect It to be cheap.     We were sat right away and we had a server ask us for drinks right away.   We didn't know what to do, but another server saw us struggling so he came by to help Us out.  We wanted a noodle dish so he recommended the lo mein.  Turned out to be yummy!  How It works? People go around with carts of dim sum and ask what you would like.  I'm a pescatarian so I'm glad they have a lot of seafood choices!  They then stamp your paper with the different group pricing.  We're still eating.  I think we'll spend about $50-$60 for 2 people and I think it's reasonable for all the food.    The service so far has been great.  The gentlemen is checking up on us but not to the point where I can't enjoy my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CcjxPvNiUQSVsBAs7m4YVw.text: OK option if you are looking for something inside the hotel that's open late. Not a place I'd personally go back to.   Spicy chili wantons (4/5) Pork Bar-B-Q over rice (3/5) a little too on the sweeter side for my taste Roasted Duck over rice (3.5/5)  Service - 4/5 Food - 3.5 Ambience - 3.5/5

Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Chili Wonton Dumplings

k8XDkDJz2YAY5r9iIe-fIA.text: Let's talk about expectations here before I get into my review.  Because if you are expecting Chinatown dim sum with a huge variety of dishes at a (hopefully) cheap price, this is not that!  There is very little that is cheap to be found at a Vegas Strip hotel restaurant.  That being said, I really enjoyed this place and I think it's a nice addition to the cuisine available at Paris.  I had just got out of the ER for food poisoning (no stars - do not recommend) and wanted to eat something that was light enough but would give me a bit of energy.  Dim sum and noodles fit the bill so I was happy to see this spot.  They do only have a couple of carts, one with steamed and one with fried, but the har gao I had were pretty good and I had some good pork and vegetable steamed dumplings.  We also ordered a vegetarian noodle plate and it was full of fresh vegetables and was really tasty.  I think it's definitely Vegas prices, but also the portions were large and the food way very good and just what I needed.

vFkjKv-l1968FHH3oWCeBA.text: I had low expectations and those expectations were met. A substandard xiaolongbao, an authentic if unimpressive niuroumian. There is not much to say. Yong Kang Street will be a place people venture to for the sake of convenience, not for the food. Casino premium on the prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xhDAt2ZG4xVUJYLZT7yIGg.text: This was our first stop on the strip and it was pretty disappointing. My parents wanted to stay on the strip so we opted for this place. It's located in Paris near the sushi place.  We came for the dim sum and it was very limited. It's definitely catered to people who are dim sum "newbies". They had a couple of the dumplings (shrimp, soup, etc), chicken feet, fried shrimp, duck, etc. They were pretty decent, nothing spectacular or awful. The soup dumplings definitely needed soup though. I also ordered a plate of stir fry udon and a stir fry veggies. The udon was surprisingly good but the veggies was pathetic. You basically get some cabbaged, carrots, 2-3 pieces of broccoli and that's it. Panda Express does it better...  We paid rougly $100 and ate less than what we usually eat at a regular dim sum place and it probably tasted better.  Overall, I have learned my lesson, rather take the time to get Uber to Chinatown for better dim sum

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the dim sum items

ezIehG8jtH7cPP6vp-ahTQ.text: I cannot say enough good things about this place we come here every time were in Las Vegas.  The dim sum carts are amazing and always filled with the yummy stuff.  I try the lobster fried rice this time because it's only serve during lunchtime and it was it so good with a large chunks of lobster

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JMUFm6qAWneB7TyeNY10Jg.text: My 6th time in Vegas and I was heavily craving noodle soup. A colleague of mine recommended this place and I'm super glad he did. Conveniently located in the center of the strip in the Paris hotel. Was sat very promptly and the food came out in less than 5 min!! They also have a dim sum and appetizer cart that comes around (that's what the little piece of paper they give you is for) you grab what you want off the cart and they mark it on your paper. Super cool. As for the shrimp noodle soup, absolutely loved it especially since the broth was NOT super salty or greasy. It had flavor without feeling like it was clogging you're arteries as you consumed it. Last but not least, the hk milk tea was awesome, don't expect it to be like a super sweet bubble tea. It wasn't too sweet, the tea and milk taste had a perfect balance, definitely recommend.

d-l59sdyS7JLYm5gOykvkA.text: Every time that I cheat on Noodles I regret it, yet I still haven't learned my lesson. In my defence, and I do have one, if we close ourselves off to new experiences then we risk complacency. Plus, my love of dim sum knows no bounds, so I can't resist, especially if they have carts. I should have tried harder to resist on a recent last-minute trip to LV.  The siu mai was mediocre in every way. The har gow was barely warm, but it was hotter than the spring roll which was straight-up cold. I had to send it back, which I am always loathe to do. Those three dishes were enough for me to call a halt to this culinary misadventure.   You can charge your meal to any Caesars hotel; they will take your ID to confirm that you are a registered guest.

lTuFyAbI8Itrzyhu6Zuo3Q.text: This is a great bite for a Vegas casino. In the grand scheme of dumplings, it's not the best but it's definitely not the worst.   The service is super fast and the food is fresh. I really enjoyed the dim sum cart! My favorite part of the meal was the shrimp shu mai. The Taiwanese noodles were also fantastic!  My advice is not to order until the dim sum cart comes around. The options are much better than the dumplings on the menu!

Kt1PdSbOYFza2oyC0hiDeQ.text: I've been here twice already and it's pretty good dim sum for las Vegas strip! Great service and everyone is very helpful when the carts come out. Our server, Mike, was especially excellent with his customer service! Very welcoming and took his time to make us feel like we were at home. He makes sure that you are having a great experience even through the madness that is Vegas. On top of the food, I will definitely return due to the wonderful service provided by Mike and the rest of the staff.

MkCmtPH0Puzj_rqoAikgtw.text: This is where I went when the Gordon Ramsay Burger bar @ Planet Hollywood disappointed me. This little gem is located in the walkway between Bally's Hotel and Paris Hotel. It is classic Taiwanese Cuisine complete with a dim sum cart and homemade noodles. There are different levels of dumplings and offerings in the cart so beware you may be grabbing a $5.88, $6.88, $7.88 or a $9.88 tin. When I went these were not marked so you really have no idea the price when you point to it so just beware when scarfing the yummy dumplings down. We also ordered BBQ, Beef Fried Rice, and Lobster Fried Rice which I honestly could only eat a few bites of because I filled up on food from the cart. This is also a noodle house, so next time I will be trying the noodles. It was a spur of the moment thing and I did not have time to figure out how to order. With time and the internet I feel like I will be more equipped next time. Here is my full video review: youtu.be/s73yx3LXkM8

_QzGkqvOuY4EPx9nhm2tEQ.text: Yum! I got the spicy shrimp wonton and they were spicy. Also Pork spare ribs. Hubby got Miso Ramen and enjoyed. Everything came out so FAST! Mike, our server was quick and attentive! A nice go to for staying open til 3am!

oTN8Pd74jR0rLnR05yT3ug.text: Get their dumpling late at night.  Located right next to the elevators they are able provide you with a nice late night snack to make sure you don't wake up with a headache to go with your hangover.  Usually everything else seems to close earlier here so this will likely be the only place where you can get something substantial without having to pay an arm and a leg.

074Ep9NhzIKw9eCJWlYz4w.text: Yong Kang is located inside Paris casino. We ordered the chicken soup and shrimp fried rice. The soup was good, as well as the rice. It was very filling. There's also a lady that walks around with cart offering dim sum. It was ok, but expensive. Overall, it's a 4 star. Will certainly return.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fried rice

rkd-JgPOGEi8v6Jqlms0tg.text: This is my go to, first meal of the trip, nom nom spot when I visit Las Vegas. I usually stay in Paris or Bally's and Yong Kang is located in the walkway connecting both casinos.   I love their dim sum. More specifically, I love their chicken feet. The feet are not too sweet and a have a little bit of kick to them. I just love the suck the yumminess off those little toes. They have a whole assortment of fried and steamed dim sum too. I also like the sticky rice and pork wrapped in the banana leaf and the shrimp dumplings.  If you don't like dim sum, I would recommend the duck and rice or a bowl of their soups. They are all yummy.   The restaurant is open really late. I often get a midnight snack from Yong Kang before heading to bed too. You can even use your points from your Total Rewards card to pay for your meal. Just have them check to see if you have any points to use.

9S6xd4pK4OSbnBqIQ608rQ.text: I thought this restaurant had some really good ramen. That's what I ordered. And it was the perfect serving for a late night dinner in chill Las Vegas in January. It warmed me to my soul. Haha!  I found it interesting that they have a server with an appetizer cart and you just pick what you want from the cart. I'm so impatient, I hate waiting for the appetizer and then also waiting extra long for my meal. So I thought that feature really added to the overall experience. We sampled the steamed during and pork dumplings from the dim sum cart. Also had fried shrimp from the cart that looked like it had a bunch of fried items on it.  The spot is quint and the great for a casual night with friends or a loved one.   Totallyyyy recommend this restaurant!

Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rZAdvkSl6ZyxvgIQnR9MFQ.text: We just enjoy the most delightful dim some lunch in the Paris Hotel today. It was light and healthy and fresh. I highly recommend this, especially on a Sunday morning. Dim Sum in Paris? You better believe it.   2/25/19 - And...we're back. Perfect stop for an incredible fresh, steaming hot bowl of Vietnamese chicken soup. It is so good! Rice noodles and sprouts bathed in a light and flavor packed broth. It includes generous amounts of chicken and a good kick from the fresh sliced jalapenos.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chili sauce always gives the kick I need.

HV4mkXe5HFAoqJPhpXd2rQ.text: Mike is awesome at Yong Kang Street at Paris Hotel.  He took care of us ! Foods awesome for a late night Asian food fix ! Yumm

Jn_hFzjd_PCVKTWKFcAVcQ.text: 3.5 stars!  Yong Kang Street serves pretty decent Cantonese & some Taiwanese food in Vegas. My friend ordered the miso ramen and said it was delicious (didn't get to try).  Food I ordered:  1) Wonton Noodle Soup @ $17: The soup was flavorful and not too heavy. The wontons inside the soup were pretty large and meaty; although not the best wontons I've had, not the worst either. The egg noodles were just OK - I picked a lot of it out since I didn't want to be overly stuffed before heading out that night. Solid 3.5 out of 5 stars.  2) Choy Sum @ $13: This is stir fired with garlic. Not amazingly tender but it was fresh and crunchy. Good option to get veggie intake in Vegas. Also 3.5 out of 5 stars.  3) Beef noodle soup @ $20: I asked for extra spicy but it wasn't spicy at all - you've been warned. The beef was very tender and fell apart easily so that was really nice. Wish there were more flavor to the broth - it tasted good but was one dimensional. Noodle quality was better than expected though - chewy and al dente! 3/5 stars for average.   Overall, Yong Kang street is a good option at the Paris Hotel if you're craving Chinese/Cantonese/Taiwanese cuisine. It's decent, especially for being on the Strip! Expensive, but not unexpected for Vegas prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. wonton noodle soup

RCnDCV_9RL9Q5Qg-n4yARQ.text: Love this place!  Yummy dim sum served all day, plus solid noodles and dumpling.    We came for the Vietnamese coffee (excellent!), we stayed for the food and came back for the warm and friendly service.  The manager at this place is Gustavo and he rocks!!!  Fast, efficient, knowledgeable and runs this restaurant like a seamless orchestra.  The food is good and prices are reasonable considering it's right on the center strip and inside a main hotel like Paris.    What makes this restaurant particularly enjoyable and keeps me coming back is the seamless execution.  From the moment you arrive, you're greeted by the hostess, from water glasses were brought by the waiter assistant, to excellent, speedy and knowledgable wait staff, to an excellent restaurant manager Gustavo!    You just love it when you leave a restaurant SATISFIED.  Thumbs up!  :)

HrpoLiQvb2PiSa_liVdlJg.text: My friend and I wanted a quick lunch after some time at the Paris pool.  We also wanted to try the dim sum.  After some confusion in communication, we tried examples of the dim sum which overall were good but overpriced.  We tried the chicken with ginger as a main entree.  What a waste of money!!  There was little chicken and no flavor.  Service was pleasant and somewhat helpful.  I will not eat at this restaurant again.

6mL29WowAbhbXVuTs2yukQ.text: A lot of negative reviews here...  I didn't think the food was bad, I actually enjoyed my meal.  The dim sum cart is a cool feature and they have a cool atmosphere, it really feels like you're on the streets of a foreign country.  The fact they can pull off that kind of environment is a plus in my book.    We had some egg rolls, dim sum and shrimp something while sitting at the table waiting for our food.  None of them were more spectacular than something from Pei Wei or Leann Chin in my opinion.  For my entree I ordered some combination of beef and broccoli with rice and had no complaints.  I did stay in my comfort zone though, if I could do it again I might try something I don't usually order since everything coming out appeared good.  Sake was served cold and so was the beer, altogether it wasn't too expensive either, solid choice...

zptrD_yYjHKxHNOWOJWAeQ.text: the food is really good , i like the beef noodle soup and also the ramen . i will visit again

iZ07gyJ9vh9cj3b0_FkO7Q.text: Fast service, friendly staff, hot meals, ordered sesame chicken and was great. Ambiance is great too

x6kxDcjnF5IIH38nLiInyQ.text: We ate here twice in three days. From LA and used to delicious Monterey Park dim sum- and were therefore surprised to discover that Yong Kang was excellent even by those standards.   You can order from a menu - which we didn't do- or you can just wait for the kind ladies with the carts to come by. Prices aren't that different from other dim sum restaurants.   The waitstaff are super attentive and friendly. All in all a great experience!

GgJmTT0iJK7PuG8L4qw0vw.text: Very good. Dim Sum reasonsbly priced for Vegas. Noodles were very tasty. Service was excellent.

HLd58oppEDvokF7o5jTOlg.text: Before you pick this place, have to very be careful, check your bill carefully, they put 18% tips on your bill without notice, even for two peoples. We asked them about it, the manager told us is was required, it's rediculs, never come back again!!!

32gH73PZ33kEN435VPPvpw.text: I was shocked at how bad this place was - especially because it looked so good, it it was always crowded. The concept is great - with dim sum carts rolling along and lots of noodle dishes, mostly Taiwanese.   However, in the end, not one dish was as good as any decent Chinese place in San Gabriel or Arcadia in So Cal, nor did it setttle as well.   Besides being super expensive, at eight bucks per dim sum and over 10 for a small bowl of noodles... but I spent the entire next day on and off the porcellin throne.   And it wasn't just me -- my friend who I went to Yong Kang with had the same problem.  I reall wish it was better. But FYI... Las Vegas has a great Chinatown - with good dim sum in carts on weekends and great Cantonese BBQ & Seafood places for dinner. There is also excellent Korean in Vegas. And the Chinatown is only 10 mins from the strip.  Bon Appitite.

CSTMrro1fDsfBdCbPwLFQg.text: Amazing service from my server Yun. Dim Sum is top notch, love the scallion pancake! Nice to sit at a place that's not pumping out Christmas music. A True to form spot with lots of character.

Yw9apCMUAGYu1VUTE5RiMg.text: This is our first night in Vegas. Our flight was delayed for an hour & half late so we were very hungry. We randomly pick this restaurant & we were pleasantly surprised. The service is very good. The waiter, Mike, was very nice and personable. The food came very faster so we were very happy even though the food was just above average. But overall we were happy with the service.

ERlHUeKQ-AcjvD4yaxGwnA.text: Definitely over priced. The food is ok. I like the Venitian noodle place. More variety and the price isn't as outrageous as this place. I only came here case it's convenient!!

Pmyp2Bw5KFSkA-tB3ib13w.text: Shrimp Wintons to die for! Same for Shanghai Lo Mein and Steamed Dumplings. Great service. And really cook chop sticks.

x5SWJqaGyJFl73odDd6RvQ.text: We ate here a couple of times while staying at Paris and the food was good both times, the Singapore noodles were prepared well, not too greasy like they often get, and the dumplings off the cart were decent for an American restaurant.  A Vegas casino restaurant is not usually going to be as good as that small family place down the street due to their scale, but this one was good.  The only complaint I would make is limited choice on the dim sum carts and that they spent more time talking than wheeling around so they were leaving money on the table. Mind you the dim sum dishes can add up if you have a few.  Other people have complained about rudeness but the staff were polite to us.

xijpF4QfhSFBnmolxN3hTw.text: Great place for the whole family. Quick and friendly service. Lun was our waiter and is funny and attentive! Definitely enjoyed our visit here. =)

b1NHlxDYFon_Q_mzd6YfQw.text: I was walking to my car when I smelled the restaurant. Like other reviews, the aroma smelled so good which enticed me to try the place. The prices were expected to be pricey because it was located in the Paris hotel. I ordered the wonton noodle soup , priced at $18.88. It was fresh and tasty. I am giving the rating 2 stars because the service was terrible. The waiter was rude and inpatient to me when I asked him menu questions. I was solo and the place was not busy at 1 am. Honestly, the only person nice to me was the busser who was helpful and packed my leftovers and gave me a water to go.

P2kLHS0aQiK02hmjOQxptg.text: One of the best dim sum I've ever had in America. The price is a little bit pricey if you wanna get full. My boyfriend and I ordered 5 different types of dimsum and an a la carte noodles and the bill in total was $80.00. So it's definitely not cheap. But honestly it's sooo good I can't complain. The wait was fast too and the service was really good. Totally recommend.

6xH2jul9KebA-f6qaII5RQ.text: I love this restaurant. The noodles are delicious. I came back this year specifically for the lo mein. My boyfriend ordered different noodles, loved them, but had a bite of my lo mein and wanted to come back to order lo mein. We also love the Dim Sum carts. You can see all the food before you choose. Everything we've had has been delicious. I'll come back to Yong Kang every time I'm in Vegas.

naR7gECDyNXia2Dazygt0g.text: I was very disappointed. After asking the woman bringing the dim sum cart around for a recommendation and she had nothing to say, I ordered the pork Dan dan noodles. There was tons of oil pooling in the bottom and the pork was so dry I couldn't eat it. That pork seemed like it was under a heat lamp for three days. $20 wasted.

3N_crNG5lgem1ApBolBfIQ.text: New Chinese dim sum place inside the Paris Hotel. I'm shocked they have dim sum at this hour.  I was forced to eat here while i was waiting for my buddies to arrive at the Paris Hotel.  I was pretty impressed and drawn to the place since I noticed they served Dim Sum in the evenings, which is not normal for a Chinese restaurant.  I ordered the brown rice, which was so freaking dry i couldn't even eat it with my chopstick, the hagaw and siomai  tasted like they were old, dry and had no flavor. But I did not stop there, since i was already there i decided to have the hong kong style wonton soup which was $14 for freaking soup! The wonton soup had thin noodles which felt like it was never ending, and the wontons had shrimp inside them, the broth was okay nothing special. After i got the bill i had a bad taste in my mouth! The food was pricey and not as good as dim sum restaurants in china town. I felt like we were paying for the ambiance just because it was inside the Paris hotel, The reason why i gave this place a 3 star was because the service was great, not your typical Chinese restaurant that's for sure! If only they cooked like your typical Dim Sum restaurant I would have given them a 4 star.  Overall, I may go back to try their other soups, their service was great, ambiance was nice , wonton soup was okay.  i did not enjoy my dim sum at all because it was too pricey and the quality was not good at all.

Average portions and a bit pricey but it is in a casino on the strip.

Pd68_kTTD5a6o3wxAsHSvQ.text: Awesome late night snack place all day and stays open late at night. The dim sum off the cart are great. Definitely will come back.

xclk4zVrB6_NsEVzSsIkFQ.text: A must when visiting Vegas! Amazing appetizers brought right to the table! Perfect dinner portions, wide variety of options for everyone and exceptional service! The manager went out of his way to assure our experience was great and offered great suggestions. Our favorite meal by far!

cFtyI6JOlXR8ySntIgsFHA.text: This restaurant grabbed my attention after we checked into our hotel. Overall, I would saw the decor of the restaurant was far more impressive than the actual food itself. I ordered dumplings and noodles if I remembered correctly, I left unimpressed so my memory is a little blurry. I do recall my main entree having lots of cilantro and I cannot stand the taste of it, so that alone ruined the experience for me. The service was super quick; I was actually astonished seeing our plates delivered within minutes of just ordering. If I just stuck with appetizers and dumplings for the evening I would have enjoyed the meal more.

xLTBaW8AQ-VGEGO-JvwMiQ.text: Came here on a week vacation. I mostly ate off the strip. Service was good and quick. Finally decide to try something inside the casino. Ordered the HK noodle soup with duck; out of all my years the worst noodles soup I ever had.

CNSeeS2tJ7Xv1qGQExnFuA.text: Delicious dim sum and noodle soup! I visit every time I go to Vegas!! Fun atmosphere and great service too!!

GETvTgxVcB1ZdnVBwMSmzw.text: Great customer service . Even for to go food open til 3am. Good fast food to help with all the drunk nights

ooVro-JyeZNTAsdHl3Dw3A.text: I had the udon noodle soup and a few dim sum dishes. The dim sum dishes were fresh and they constantly come around with the cart. A little pricey compared to regular dim sum but everything in Vegas is more expensive than the norm. The soup was also good but if I go again, I would just get the dim sum dishes.  There was no wait for dinner on a Saturday night around 7, but it did start getting busier as I was there. Great for a sit down dinner with food that arrives very quickly and is right in the middle of the shops between Bally's and the Paris.

nEEcXZ_aAE0oK_q_yn35Uw.text: After a few days of straight American food we were in some serious need of some asian cuisine. Someone recommended that we come here. We started with some dim sum. It was all pretty decent, a little over priced but hey we're in a casino, what do you expect. I ordered the duck noodle soup since I was feeling a little under the weather. It was decent for a run of the mill Chinese place  catering to all people. Better than what you would get at a random take out place but not quite comparable to an authentic restaurant in Chinatown. It satisfied our cravings without having to leave the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4Hf67tW4F_Pbj_WX-YiqxQ.text: As someone who lived in Taiwan for over 10 years and ate some of the best beef noodle soup and dumplings while growing up, I can honestly say that this is my favorite place to get beef noodle soup in Vegas. The noodles are always cooked perfectly and the beef is tender and juicy. Our server tonight was Joe and he was fantastic! We love adding the pickled vegetables to our soup and he immediately offered to bring us extra which was awesome! All in All I Love coming to this restaurant and am never disappointed!

hJNF7DAm1SukAsebxnZtJw.text: Our server "Joe" said we had to leave a good review about him to redeem our "free drink" for checking in. I'm sure they will continue to be paying the insane amount to Yelp yearly to keep all the bad reviews off. Unfortunately it doesn't seem to be working as they are still three stars despite trying to scam their guests. Won't be paying $20 for a $5 bowl of noodles anymore thanks to their dirty business tactics. Plan backfired!

Ea86ZOGsOr6GU0nXOk7Njw.text: Super excited to be back. As always my favorite place. I love the soup with veggies. I brought my bestie a d my husband. The also are huge fans.

sNtUZVpLLAJr9ewB-WX4vQ.text: okay, the shuami and hai gow is not comparable to what you find it OC but decent. price is expensive for what it is but you're in vegas so what do you expect.

TNCpdZoVtTeYPDjLYg9t5w.text: Very good little Dim Sum restaurant in the Paris hotel, shrimp dumplings, short ribs, roasted duck fried rice were all delish

W17tTS5MaaVEjtL1k3vwuw.text: My husband and I were here 3 weeks ago ....Soooo yummy!!! Their spicy dumplings were my favorite!!!!!! My husband and I had to go back twice in 2 days!! I still crave it...

uF6bXxFYK7zPV2vieJt91A.text: Mike was Awesome! He made us feel at home at this restaurant! The dim sum and soup was amazing! We will be back for sure!

OgMcd6S801VKbTMIJbTolw.text: Friendly and efficient service. Reasonable prices for the Strip. Loved the TenRen's tea and traditional dim sum cart service. Dim sum itself was tasty - most of the traditional dishes there like siu mai, har gow, pork buns, and potstickers. Also ordered the house fried rice, which was okay, but would probably try something else next time. Definitely satisfies Chinese food craving.

-cPIepPn6ubjAl9ychu95w.text: Came here for a late night bite. Joe and Alex offered amazing service. The service was fast and the food was good.

9pJtJim-_Vz_XmRoGTrrxQ.text: After getting robbed at some 'high end' places I convinced my friends to give it a shot it was in our hotel and smelled good. I am now currently the savior and we have plans to eat here again tomorrow before our flights. Good dim sum, loved the pork and shrimp, great duck and noodles soups. I've been to China and we all know it's gonna be slightly Americanized but overall was AWESOME!

nsiOfsAwLtdH06wHzwvcPA.text: I was nervous to try after I read all the negative reviews, but this place is truly awesome! So good in fact, we ate there for dinner two days in a row!  Service is amazing and food comes out within 5 minutes of ordering. I got the stir-fried ramen with lobster the first night (it was HEAVENLY) and the next, shrimp tempura udon. I recommend the ramen over the udon, but both were fantastic. Spring rolls are also great!   I'd come here again and again if I could. Definitely delicious and fairly reasonable for the amount of food you get.  TRY THIS PLACE!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tempura Udon. Yum!

pU4Yo3sQmVLK5OnE7hzuHQ.text: I came here with my family for some lunch. This Chinese restaurant is located in the Paris casino.  The layout of the restaurant is really cute. It looks like an open air cafe in the streets of Paris or something. There's cute lights hanging from the sign, and tables "inside" the railing as well as "outside" the railing (so it looks like you're eating on the street).  The menu is mixed dimsum and ordering entrees. To my amazement, there was actually a woman pushing a dimsum cart around the tables. But be warned that it's Vegas and the prices are a lot higher than your usual dim sum place. Small, medium, and large orders are closer to $7, $8, and $9 per dimsum order.  I thought this place wouldn't be that good but I was surprised by the quality of the food. The pineapple bun dimsum was pretty good! The buns were very fresh and large, and the pineapple bun coating/shell on the top was delicious. It was probably the most expensive pineapple bun I purchased from anywhere ($3.88 for two buns) but it was still good.  The xiao long bao came in an order of 4. It was decent, but I thought the dumplings could have been a little bigger and juicier. Probably not worth the I think $8-$9 for a small order of 4.  The dan dan noodles were interesting. The sauce was excessive so it almost looked like a soup noodle dish when you get the bowl. But I thought the sauce turned out well, since it was really peanut/sesame flavored. It was also quite spicy too! I ordered duck with the noodles (you get a choice of meat), but I didn't think the BBQ duck went that well with the dan dan noodles sauce.  The ramen broth was a bit too watery for my taste but mild enough for my dad.  Scallion pancake was good too, although it's just the pancake, no egg like my mom would make it at home!  Also don't try to get Total Rewards points here. It doesn't seem to work, and after talking to the Total Rewards desk, you can redeem your points here but I think the minimum was like 200 points for $1 (hardly seems worth it especially for casual Vegas goers like me).

jCjjAi4fcoi7bi7n-dGftQ.text: Located in the Paris Casino, Yong Kang Street offers dim sum and noodles and other Chinese fare. The layout of the restaurant is pretty cool- styled to look like a Taiwanese noodle shop, with a dim sum lady going around with the carts. We had a fairly large group (10 people) but they were accommodate us quickly. Service was quick and attentive, with no mix ups with the orders. One friend ordered the roast duck and the rest of us got noodle soups. I ordered the Hong Kong wonton noodle soup- it was huge and satisfying, and the wontons were stuffed with meat and shrimp. Food was good but a little expensive for what it is (but its Vegas, so I guess everything is expensive- but then again, I'm from NYC where things are expensive, and the price of the noodle soup surprised even me) Totally A-OK place

5TVfd3jLPdJQD-IK6gGtIA.text: Almost felt like I was back in Hong Kong where I had the best dim sum. Service could have been a little faster but it was pretty packed. I would return again if I were back in the area.

s0Br-QOt0jyMRzFyu1v8Xg.text: Loved the decoration of the place! The dim sum tasted good but presentation was poor. They had one cart rolling around to serve dim sum. Beef noodle soup wasn't bad, but $18 was actually kind of crazy for how average it was. Also, they put jalapenos and iceberg lettuce on top, which was very confusing (although the jalapenos did add nice flavor)

A1HijxkdD7BJ6oE0vwbW9A.text: Loved this small little restaurant in between the Bally's hotel and the Paris, it specializes in dim sum and we had a excellent tawaniese beef noodle soup (share as the portion is enough for two). Dim sum are small orders and range from 5.88 - 9.00. Despite the mediocre reviews I appreciate the small portions and you can pick and choose as you go.

aP_V6XgWwhhdr4loVJI5Gg.text: Great place to get a quick, good meal. They roll carts around and offer you dim sum and or their appetizers. Great fast service. And if you check in you get options of a drinks. Thai tea delicious fyi.

nZSmTGsJuOzvQBCbNIHxKQ.text: Love that this place is open til 2am!  Food is great and the Thai Iced Tea is perfect!  Not too sweet but smooth.  Yum!

PHs5B9cmqzF73sc35kk6dQ.text: Almost a 4-star, depending on one's mood & situation.  Even though I'm a CBC, and prefer non-Chinese food, after 3 days of heavy eating, chowing down on one's grass roots is a natural phenomena--I think lol.  So during my many frequents back and forth Paris/Ballys/Planet Hollywood, and passing by YKS and their super long lineups, my first initial glance is, 'nah, made for westerners, I can eat this stuff at home'...  Eventually curiosity got the better of me, and despite the high prices (which I can accept, it's vEgas, it's our crappy Canadian dollar), I just have to try it out.  Besides, mostly Asians were eating here, probably for the same reason lol.  First off, the veggies were great.  Bak choy at this stage, my body needs it.  Wonton noodle, pretty decent too.  And the broth wasn't as loaded with MSG as to be expected.  Roast duck, pieces-wise adequate in itself, and we're not exactly in Chinatown, so for $18, whatever.  now, we were totally impressed by the service, spoke Cantonese a few times.  Unlike other restaurants, it's OKAY to order just cold water--what's even cooler, is that they topped up a few times too.  Liked the picnic style seating along the wall.  Yes, long lineups as usual everywhere, and honestly, not worth the wait if you're short on time.  But a nice change.

mTuuexC-WC1Li0uGxSOJmg.text: So it was late at night, because its Vegas of course, when we tried this place.   We got three bowls of chicken noodle soup, Taiwanese style. It did hit the spot--great flavorful broth, well cooked chicken, very delicious noodles, and the addition of broccoli was also very nice. The chili oil they bring you adds a nice taste it as well. I asked for limes and the server brought my lemon, so its definitely not pho friendly, but again its a good noodle soup that can substitute for pho when you need it most. I would say it was a pho/ramen hybrid.  Overall it was delicious with good service but I'm not sure I would go again unless I really needed something late night. It just may have not been my taste. But I would recommend :)

7EHIjq39HjrMUIbbxHTQsQ.text: Great Dim Sum! Excellent service! Go here if your looking for great quality and quick friendly service:)

cx7OOUUiIrtoSDgWHLyaDQ.text: This is probably the best Asian spot on the strip. If you've had a bit to drink, and need some quality healthy food for your demolished soul, come here and to re-energize to get yourself back to tip top shape. Ask for Mike bc he's the bomb. Great atmosphere, take a right, walk to the back and the first spot on the left.

0UiUwIWJtrPAJrb7ku-A4g.text: Really good late night food, particularly if you have just spent the evening drinking and gambling.  The dim sum was very fresh and the steamed pork dumplings were particularly good.  I enjoyed the Hong Kong style noodles with duck and everything was very fresh.  The only thing keeping this from being a 5 star review was the amount of fat and sinew in the duck.  Perhaps I just got a bad cut but it's nothing that will stop me from returning.

GvIw_ayREKGbDg3yw92llA.text: This is one of my favorites places in vegas everytime I'm in town I have to come here  waiting for the lady with the dumpling cart makes everything more exiting, order some luckybuddha now one of my favs beers! Crew super friendly I always order what they really like from the menu 'cause they know is good. I just in love with this place

xsXR3jjS5bKjvrnsmiF_vA.text: So delicious! Great customer service. Mike is so awesome and so attentive. If you need a suggestion about what to order, he's the guy!

AHpNz08Ut5f2-UUjlKsW2A.text: Hong Kong noodle soup with duck and steamed bbq pork buns! Perfect late night snack, and excellent service!

b4P95HsNyEFRNxrOgrUwnw.text: Not sure why this doesn't have better reviews. Great noodle soup and dim sum in carts and all served until 3am. Fantastic!!  Was hungry after a night out at the Cosmo and was craving some noodle soup. Looked up where would still be open at 2am and found this place. Rocked in there at 2:30am and got seated. Ordered noodle soup but the dim sum cart was still going around for anyone that wanted it.   My husband got the wonton noodle soup and said it was good. A few big wontons and a ton of noodles. I had the BBQ pork noodle soup and it was great. Exactly what I was looking for. Lots of noodles and a decent amount of meat.   I will definitely be coming back here next time we are in town!

yxJduKGqReSy1w6kISdOXQ.text: Delicious food both from the dim sum cart and from the menu. The service was extremely fast as well. The music was louder than I'd like for a dinner atmosphere, making it harder to hear our conversations. I'd still go back if I'm ever around.

xPYGaGwVdr157khCXLgOJQ.text: The Hong Kong style pork and shrimp wonton noodle soup was amazing! Very friendly staff and super fast service. I will definitely be coming back in the future.

CF_SqTsR_M6f4VhvtLWXhQ.text: What?! $15 for Won Ton Mein?! $19 for Taiwan Beef Noodle Soup?!  $6 for two Char Siu Bao?!  Are they NUTS?!  Won Ton Noodle Soup - broth was good, though not enough for the amount of noodles given; won ton was tasty - only given 3 pcs, and are not Shrimp. Taiwanese Beef Noodle Soup - fair, of course, and no where as delish as on the streets of Taiwan.  No free tea here!  And not even loose leaf tea! $4/pot.  Unless I'm dying of hunger, I'll pass this restaurant on my next visit.

xVJwrA0BiuKEQdF4tKlb8A.text: Mike and Gus need Raises ASAP!!! top of the line service!!! Only reason we keep coming back year after year!

WEpZU6vEHy5c3bYpBroQWw.text: The name of the restaurant makes me think of my hometown so I decided to give it a try, and Yong Kong Street does not make me down! The beef noddle is authentic, and the bubble tea is awesome!! Reminds me of home, so glad to see they got such good Taiwanese food in Vegas. I would definitely come again next time!!

ChJ2ssR_WY1ZysIEQpBlcg.text: Fast service, incredible dim sum. We stopped off for just appetizers and weren't disappointed. We're coming back to this place just to have the dim sum. Great place and great staff.

QlitE08VYuFX3sGD-UfGxQ.text: I didn't expect to be able to find good Chinese food on the strip. Gotta be honest I just doubt they could be authentic and actually have the flavor it's supposed to. I am surprised. I've walked by this place every time I'm in Vegas and I always just assumed that a Chinese restaurant inside a hotel called Paris didn't scream authentic. We stopped by at about 1 or 2 in the morning and it was just incredible. Tasted great, the broth of the noodle soup wasn't too salty and still had flavor without being a thick soup. The only critique I have would be the service. It was just a little bit on the abrasive side; a little rough around the edges but other than that and the fact that the spicy wonton wrappers were a little thick. It was perfect. Price could be a little lower for the quality of food and the experience given but you are on the strip and this is to be expected. I would recommend one visit just to try it out but it wouldn't be a repeat for me unless I was craving this specifically.
