LRGq4zSf-aIb7bjI7cGICw.text: My home is nearby Yong Kang Street in Taiwan, so I often grab some food there. The food in this restaurant tastes totally different from the food in my hometown, way below the standard. Not recommend at all.

YI_yOkCWWpZud74E4RgE2Q.text: The dim sum is really good. Prices of other things on the menu are a little high in price, but it has good flavor.

6ShEJ817lEwVz4MyCimhdg.text: Would give no stars if it was an option- don't waste your money. Good server but god awful food. Only good thing was the black tea. Fried rice was rancid. Lo mein noodles were crunchy. I'm mean seriously crunchy. The dumplings- well I've had better out of a box and it cost over $50. Would never go back

NpqxAK3BXQ3XYCYBVatixQ.text: We had a late night gambling and decided to stop by Yong Kang Street for a bite.  We started with the steamed pork dumpling and Spicy chili wonton! Both appetizers were excellent.  We shared the tonkotsu ramen and it was delicious! Thumbs up to Joe and Mike who were helpful and professional.  I would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a late night bite!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wa2z5H4lAM2BZrN1PEXYbw.text: This is located inside the Paris Hotel and is open late which are both convenient. I tried the dim sum which was average. The prices are a little expensive but inline with Vegas strip pricing. The service was good.

Ziiccnk3qS6uXYVb78JxYw.text: Wanted something different and never had Taiwanese food.  It was wonderful, reasonably priced, and fast.   Tasted fresh and it will be the bar set for all future food of this type.

u8fFiBjCqCCC8LbN2BM1rA.text: This place has a high price for mediocre Chinese food. If you don't have a car but have the time, walk over to Bellagio where they have high priced but rgood Chinese food. If you have the car and the time, head to Chinatown or even inside Gold Coast for great Chinese food for a third of the price or less.   Alas, I had neither a car nor time and had to order to go to back to my room. I've given this place a few chances previously and have had a few items. The beef stew noodles were barely passable, but was too greasy. The lobster noodles were a farce, you get pieces of frozen rubbery lobster meat added to a low cost noodle soup and get charge what could be a whole lobster elsewhere already. Dim sum items were ok but costly. The only thing I figured out was consistently good was the roasted duck and BBQ pork items.   BUT- they cheat you on the to go orders and give you meatless-skin-on-bone-only pieces. Figuring you couldn't be bothered to go back for replacement or complaints if you were in a hurry! So be sure to check before walking away.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What did they expect me to do with these meatless pieces?

Lw4_M7pHCddyWkO5OI5rpA.text: We stayed at the Paris Hotel and would keep walking by this place and finally had to try it. So yummy! It's fun to have the dim sum and try little bites of each thing. Very nice and friendly wait staff (Leng) and the manager (Lun) was so generous and brought us a Mochi ice cream dessert on the house because we were celebrating a birthday.

x7YvT271dU1ZroSpBotQ9Q.text: Hotel restaurants don't ever really appeal to me but this place is a must-try! We ordered the roasted duck & bbq pork noodle soup and got the steamed sticky rice & bbq pork buns from the cart. The flavors were all def there & the food just hits the spot! We'll be visiting everyday while we're here... ps. The Vietnamese coffee is awesome too!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed sticky rice &amp; BBQ pork buns

uv4PCmV88R0n5_cyg5-yPw.text: A very nice and authentic combination Dim Sum, noodle and Cantonese restaurant within the Paris Hotel complex. Does not take reservations but after a gory wait we were seated and immediately offered freshly prepared baskets and plates of the 20 varieties of Dim Sum offered. A full menu of large portions of soups, rice and noodle dishes supplements the Dim Sum selection. We shared a large bowel of shrimp wonton soup, 4 plates of tastes Dim Sum and we're happy campers after a $50 total meal for two, a veritable bargain on the Strip.

EQKfRsvKEHknFpBwCsI42Q.text: Had dim sum!  Everything was great!  The soup dumplings could have been hotter-temp wise and the steamed rice was a little dry.. and I was worried from another review that the casing was going to be super thick, but it wasn't that bad! We had shumai, chicken legs, shrimp dumplings, charsubao, and steamed rice.  My mom raved about the chicken legs!! I didn't try them  service was quick and friendly.  I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0D3O0eyk_19egDCfQqO7IA.text: Nice noodle! I best ever!!! We have  and chashu rice,also hk milk tea. Everything is just so awesome and I can't find anything better here in Las Vegas Nevada.  Especially for the noodles , it reminds me of my younger hood life back in college. The taste is exactly the same as in China, I was even moved in tears.

S0evo_LIZSYfEaHRPIkXDA.text: The Yong Kang Street is a convenient spot inside the Paris hotel with tasty Asian food, good service and really cute decor. We grabbed a late night bite to go, and definitely appreciated that there was a place where we could get a meal that didn't taste like fast food at midnight.   The food itself was ok, but not the best noodle soup I've ever had, either. Thus the 3 stars.   Would I go back? Yes. Mostly for the convenience, but also because I know that their food tastes good and the service is also good. I think I'd rather have a sit down meal, to enjoy the decor and ambiance, instead of just doing take out.

0WAbWfr0oCYZ-PjNZ1Sf7A.text: My boyfriend and I came here for lunch, we were not disappointed. The staff was super friendly from the minute we walked in. The portions are HUGE but very delicious. Would definitely come back!

4qPwBYXzo91JlySj5o6G6w.text: It's pretty good for being in Vegas. But can't compare to authentic Chinese dumplings.

V-iqnShUJBivq-86q62TVw.text: Great service. I love the ginger sauce. The fried rice was extra tasty. I had to minus a point for the heavy peanut sauce in the Dan Dan noodles. I recommend the crab that is deep fried that comes on the cart. I don't know what it's called, but it was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MvKhxBnJvfNuHAPhTcSaEA.text: It was delicious! I recommend it! We ordered the dumplings! They were very good! The service was vet good! They were very nice and refilled our water constantly!

2rJp9DkT1_KDo1iADLA6Rw.text: I was really craving dim sum and found this place! Their food reminds me of places back home. My favorites were definitely the chicken feet, har gow, and shumai. I found my go to spot whenever I'm in Vegas staying on the Strip!

Rwux_6Qy8OieRJzn46Eo2Q.text: Excellent customer service from our server Joe. He was very attentive. Food was good and the service was speedy.

nUErHziz3wJ2tOj7Ek2JZg.text: Just spent 4 days at Bally's and ate here twice.  Great food, the spicy dumplings on the menu are amazing.  Great noodles.  Service was fast and efficient. Was open late, which made it a great place to get a late night bite after losing at cards.  I will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.

lfTQ5JCAyGpknnm-L65yKw.text: Surprisingly good dim sum late at night! It doesn't compare to any of my favorites in NY, LA, or even SF, but quite good for Vegas, especially the Strip.

FIDtSBQTAY2LPyILCgoelg.text: Egg noodles and dense little wontons were fantastic.  Soup base was great. Dumplings and Pork buns from the carts were the same.  I'm a dim sum and noodle veteran and All in all a great experience.  Not sure what's with the past reviews that gave low marks.

ceFhK2mvs423PURgO14iXA.text: Sorry but this place is not worth to many words . Except very very below average and  Very very over priced  Would not go back

hgQUsWeZCNVLqLlgvKo3Ng.text: 4 stars for dim sum carts and Hot green tea. Great services  waiters /waitresses always smiling . Stayed in vegas 3 days atet there 3 times. Loved it!!!!

r7oPQZImHtgaTsdw-MQDUw.text: Great place and good street style vibe. Hong Kong Wonton Noodle Soup was excellent as well as the dumpling cart. Mike was the best server

RRpAkQmQe4-DnXXVQ6mEkQ.text: We were sceptical after reading the reviews but it was pretty good. The pork shrimp dumpling was good and we enjoyed the miso and  eat noodle soup. But don't order the Dan Dan noodles

-05u07h58CgMoTu6VdWb3A.text: Average Vegas prices with yummy beef noodle soup and our favorite pork soup dumplings and spicy dumplings, very much like Din Tai Fung! Would come back for sure!

FV8LnQD5lqVqI-FsjBcE4Q.text: At 2am, the food is just want the doctor ordered! And the Service was 5 stars by Mike and Ivan. Not sure why they have 3 stars

psAzq1n6zJo3Wypi7Feq2g.text: Taste is not bad. Yet, I am not extremely impressed either. Price is high. I have no issue with paying for great quality/taste, yet, Yong Kang Street does not deliver what I expected. Also, staffs are not well trained enough to understand English.

5XDciCGcjpZ6V2oc5uWHRQ.text: The food is good, very pricey for low portions but it is very tasty. Now the service lacks unfortunately they have potential. Just don't give me the wrong order twice and assume once we get our food you don't have to check on us mr Alex. Was very kind of one of the line cooks to come to my table to ask if everything was well since he noticed the lack in the waiters. The place is beautiful as well, nice ladies going around in dim sum carts as well.

jGifvhl41CXa3ZIrT1mfSw.text: Food was good our waitress could have been more attentive.  The soup dumplings are awesome.

IkJaR9nsNRtikbboaLXiCg.text: Definitely go there again when I am down to Las Vegas. Try Taiwanese noodle soup and beef fried rice. They are authentically delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Dumpling. One star off because of this. The pork inside is juicy, but the wrapped flour is not fresh.
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Fried Rice. All ingredients are blended in one. Love it!
Photo of Yong Kang Street - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Definitely try this. I love the noodle and its soup. Delicious!!!!

yxnFky-R1BE2VwY7zU_Xuw.text: Stumbled upon this place by accident.  I have probably walked past it a hundred times and never noticed it.  We were able to get seated pretty quickly and found that the place had an upbeat and vibrant atmosphere.  It was clean and comfortable.  A great place to hang when you want a fun night out.  While the food is a little pricey, you pay for the location.  I kind of like the fact that the prices ended in .88.  We were on the Strip and didn't feel like heading out because we were on a roll.  The Dim Sum cart had a great offering.  The food was flavorful, salty and delicious.  I enjoyed the Chinese Broccoli in Oyster Sauce.  It was savory and salty.  The broccoli was cooked al dente and had a nice firmness to it.  The spicy won ton dumplings were full of flavor.  I would have preferred them spicier, but then again, I didn't ask them to be spicier, and being in Vegas, this restaurant has to cater to all types of people.  Like my mom.  She thinks that the pico de gallo on a fajita at Chili's is too spicy.  This would have probably killed her.  So, we have covered the price, touched on the ambience, and talked about the food.  What's left?  The service.  It was attentive.  It was seamless.  I didn't have to ask for anything as my needs were anticipated by the staff.  It didn't disturb our conversation and we almost didn't notice it, which is the best service there is.

zfc8attzCnGoDfEO8XxCYw.text: We stumbled upon this amazing restaurant while walking through Paris. I've been wanting to try Dim Sum and it did not disappoint. The dim sum carts are so fun and everything was delicious. Order the house fried rice. So good!
